description:
Pretty good spot for Thai food! I got the pad see ew with tofu to go and it didn't disappoint. It was a large quantity - though i wish the proportion of both tofu and vegetables to noodles was a little higher. 

Other than that, the tofu was nicely fried and not greasy. The noodles had a good texture and flavor. I wish there had also been more of the sauce with the pad see ew and that way the noodles would have had more flavor as well.
author: Valeria S.

description:
Got delivered through postmates and all i gotta say, though the food was decent, my meal didnt come with rice even though it was 9 dollars, luckily i always order extra rice but that means i just had even less rice that i expected. 

I had ordered the yellow curry chicken entree and it was literally soup, curry shouldnt be soup i couldnt even finish it, i wont say it wasnt bad but i wont be ordering here again
author: Air B.

description:
I'm really surprised that this place rates pretty high.  I had two things for dinner: fried crab cakes, and chicken pad thai.  The crab cakes were decent; nothing great; crab with some filler that was deep fried.  2 or 2.5 stars.  The pad thai, on the other hand, was probably the WORST pad thai I've had in my life.  And I've eaten A LOT of pad thai (I'm a native of SF and have been eating Thai food since I was a kid).  I think they re-heated the pad thai that they cooked a day before.  The noodles were hard and chewy.  The fried tofu was super duper hard and gummy.  The chicken was stringy (in long pieces, which I've never seen before in Thai).  And where was the bean sprouts?  The ground peanuts?  The green scallions?  The freshly cooked eggs?  There were a few measly green onions, and I think some sprinkles of ground peanuts.  It looked like a giant plate of ORANGE: orange noodles, fried tofu, and strips of chicken.  There was no color, no freshness, no vibrancy.  It was all so bland and gummy.  It was actually hard to eat.  I've had such experiences before, where you want to eat fast, and just get it over with.  This was like that!  UUUGGHHHHH!    

Because I had an appetizer, I didn't eat the whole pad thai.  Typically I'll save my leftovers and eat it the next day.  NOT THIS!  I threw that stuff in the compost bin!  NO WAY I'm going to eat such terrible food again!

The sad thing is that the other Thai restaurant in the neighborhood (Pad Thai Restaurant), is closed.  And I think permanently.  What a shame.  They made very good Thai food.  I won't bother coming back to this place.  How can you make bad pad thai?  I mean it's one of their signature dishes!  But I guess you can.  I'll just have to jump in my car and go to a Thai restaurant in another neighborhood when I feel like eating Thai.  

HASTA LA VISTA SWEET BASIL!
author: Ramon C.

description:
I haven't dined in but I've ordered their food through UberEats. So, this is based solely on the food.

I think the food is well flavored and decently sized.

And, as an FYI, they are true to their spice level!
I got pad thai in spicy and chicken in spicy and man! My mouth was slightly on fire. And, I'm a girl who can eat spicy. Not complaining Bc I loved it!

Pad Thai was flavored well. 

Chicken with veggies were bathed in delicious sauce. 

The tom yum soup was enough for two to share. Loved that it had distinct Thai flavors.

This is a good casual restaurant for dine in or takeout.
author: Ngoc P.

description:
We had dinner tonight with some friends and I have to say half of our food was way too salty or too sweet. I ordered the chicken noodle soup, and we also had the duck curry, spicy cat fish, and crab fried rice. We also had their Thai ice tea. The Thai ice tea was way too sweet, I had to dilute it with my water. I still couldn't finish it cause it didn't taste right. 

My chicken noodle soup was so salty I couldn't even eat 1/4th of it. I ended up telling our waitress and she said she'll let the chef know, and she apologized hoping she would at lease take it off the bill cause it wasn't even touched practically, but she did not.  

The duck curry was really good, and the crab fried rice was good. Spicy cat fish was crispy and tender but the sauce is also very salty. 

We wanted to try this place but hoped we went somewhere else.
author: Amy A.

description: I only ordered the papaya salad to eat something light. While I only paid 11.3 after tax and no tip for take out, the portion was still absolutely tiny. The salad looked deflated and was too spicy. Now I have a good spice tolerance for an Asian person but this was way too much. I was crying by the end.
author: Vivian L.

description: It was quiet when I got there to meet a friend and only one couple in Resturant. It was about 6:30 on a Tuesday but it began to pick up the music had a house down tempo that fit the mood. I ordered two Thai iced teas and shrimp spring rolls with a peanut sauce. It was really good fresh then I ordered shrimp fried rice it was good but I wish I had like a cucumber side to go with the meal it would of made the dish feel a bit lighter. I liked it enough to go back.
author: RICHARD J.

description:
Good environment and services. 
I ordered the duck curry from the  lunch menu. And it's good! 
But actually, the size is not enough for me. The price is reasonable for that.
author: Yantong Z.

description: Had meal delivered via Yelp/Grubhub so can't rate service or physical space. For the price I feel the portion size was a bit small, which was disappointing. The crispy spring rolls were a bit bland. The soup Tom Yum Gai was tasty, enough for 2, although found a small chicken bone in the broth. Pad Thai was average, not memorable. Green curry was the best dish, ordered it regular spicy and it was perfect for me (I like spicy). I put the curry on the Thai fried rice so I can't rate the fried rice on its own, but the 2 together were very good.
author: Shawn H.

description:
Bad visit for us today.. our orders of 2 different curries and seafood soup has shrunk omg.. and the rice isn't cooked. Wasn't enough water to cook the rice.. REAlly ?? And the chef usually cook our food he isn't there.. so so sad.. we also asked for fresh dice Thai peppers .. which waitress didn't understand us or what?? As we told her is from kitchen  chef usually dice for us.. hmmm disappointing lunch.. 
this place has curries but without good steam rice ... they should jus close for the day or buy new rice cooker.. 
we might jus not come back anymore after today..!!
author: Crisy G.

description:
I love Thai so having this round the corner is superb.

Got panang curry, fish cakes and tom yum soup as takeout.

The tom yum soup totally hit the spot on a cold winters night. The soup had depth and was spicy but lacked fillings. The fish cake was good too although the panang curry was a touch sweet and not as authentic as I expected it to be.

A hit and a miss but will be back to try other dishes.
author: Carmen P.

description:
Awful customer service.  They delivered food that was too spicy to be edible - and this is not just me who made this assessment. There were 5 other people all of us could not eat the food b/c it was too spicy.  The maximum spicy level we indicated was medium spicy - with one dish being mild. 

Stay away
author: S M.

description: Just ordered red curry and pad see ew for pickup. Only took 15 minutes and was delicious. Ignore the h8rs and try it for yourself
author: Tyler J.

description: If you like an authentic Thai with sharper taste of the South East Asian flavors, give this place a try. Just like the name, some stir fried dishes taste sweeter than usual and isn't too dry. The place is perfect for families indeed. Would definitely come again in the future! (and bring my family here).
author: Moorissa T.

description: This place definitely lives up to its name. The curries are extremely sweet and almost inedible. The pad see yew has none of that seasoned wok flavor, however it's still decently tasty, hence the 2 stars. There's a lot of average Thai joints in this city where you can get a decent curry and some good noodles, this is not one of them. Spend a couple more bucks and go somewhere else.
author: Nic B.

description: This place was amazing! Their food was delicious and superflavorful. Our server Magnum was on top of it. Very attentive and friendly. Food came out quick too! Would definitely recommend.
author: Sioux H.

description: Heavy greasy food that left me feeling really gross afterward. Ordered the veg & tofu pad kee mao and green curry fried rice. Fried rice was better than the pad kee mao, which was very oily and heavy. Stomachs feel really bad and weird even an hour afterward. The waitress also didn't give us the beers we ordered, even though we reminded her twice. Won't come back.
author: Becca C.

description: Ate here for the first time today - I got the masaman curry with chicken to go. Decent size, although doesn't come with rice, but was tasty and flavorful. A bit too much onions but enjoyable. Not 3 hours later it had me running to the bathroom, multiple times. I'm reluctant to take my chances here again.
author: Dan B.

description:
For delivery to go review and not dine in.

I was feeling for soup.  Tom Yum Gai was on the sweet side and I prefer it to be on that sour, lemongrass side more. 

Chicken wings were meh. Sauce was not enticing and not enough meat. 

I liked their ginger fried fish.  They gave very little fried fish, though.  Sauce was good with rice to soak it up. 

Pumpkin curry was on point.  Their naan was crisp and great with the curry as a dipper!

Hits the spot.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Don't come here hungry. The people here are slow. They don't say anything when you sit down. Took 10
Minutes to get a menu. If I could give 0 stars I would . They have literally been open less than an hour . Horrible service . Don't bother . Piss poor ! Save yourself from this bullshit
author: Jessica T.

description: This place is great! Very cute decor, great prices, amazing food and nice service! This will be my go to Thai spot from now on
author: Karishma A.

description:
Pad Thai acceptable. Panang Curry flavorless, watery sauce with chili oil floating on top that refuses to be mixed into the curry sauce; no hint of coconut or cashew or any of the other ingredients that define Panang.

Two stars only because the Pad Thai was edible.  Prefer One Waan, Osha, or Regent over this place by a large margin.
author: A.J. F.

description: This place is shady. I order almost $70 worth of food. We were all in the back on the deck so we didn't hear the delivery girl come by. She did not leave the food at the door and they didn't refund me my money. I called and no answer.  I emailed them and no response.  I will never order from their shady asses again with their dry ass pad thai unflavored noodles.
author: Jae J.

description: The food was really mediocre. It could have passed for fronzen trader Joe's food. The deliver was 45 minutes late and cold. Would not order again.
author: Tyler S.

description:
Never order from this restaurant via yelp. This is the worst customer service experience i have ever had for delivery. 

I ordered via yelp & received a weird message after it told me the order was processed in the app that there was an error. I called the restaurant and spoke with two different people, a man and a woman, who both confirmed that my order went through despite the weird message.

An hour later when my food should have arrived, I called the restaurant to make sure they had my phone number to call when they were here. At that time, they told me that they did not have my order & confirmed that they didn't receive it. The guy acted like he didn't care at all and did not ask if I wanted to place an order despite the trouble. 

There's a million thai places, never eat here.
author: Kylie F.

description: I can't decide whether I like Sweet Basil better or Pad Thai Restaurant. Both is good but Sweet Basil has a better atmosphere and nicer seating for big groups. My work goes to both for all-staff lunch celebrations. I liked the thai iced tea, pad thai, and duck noodle soup here.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
I called to order for delivery but I decided 
To stop by and they already delivered. Fast service, food was good even though the order was not too big.
author: Mapi V.

description: Bad delivery. Ordered rice later at night. They only filled container less than a quarter with stale rice.
author: Zach R.

description: DO NOT EVER ORDER FROM THIS RESTAURANT! How in the world are they rated #1 on YELP for Thai delivery. I placed an order 6:45p on a Sunday night via Seamless. At 7:55 which was the end of the delivery estimate I called the restaurant. They told me the order was out for delivery. At 8:20 when I still had not received my order I called again and they said the same thing but said they would call the driver. At 8:45 (TWO HOURS LATER) I called again and they admitted the order was there. Unclear if it was even processed or never went out for delivery. They didn't try to help with any solutions. Unbelievably poor service.
author: Liz V.

description:
First time try this place Thur Door Dash

It was fast less than 45 mins

Food came great.

$10.45 for each dish
Penang Chicken Current
Beef Egg Plant, the beef was kind of hard to chew, 
It was a little over cooked.

I would try this place for other things on their menu.
author: Mack A.

description: The food is consistent, delicious, and cooked with love!! My go-to Thai restaurant!!!
author: Anna S.

description: The presentation of the fresh salad rolls looks like garbage. Lettuce looks old. These "fresh" rolls is definitely not worth $8.50! The wings of love, taste like reheated chicken. It was so tough to bite into. The crab fried rice barely had crab, just taste like fried rice. And the pad thai was sitting in so much sauce. When I mixed the sauce with the noodle, it still looked like soup! Gross! I used UberEats to deliver since I've eaten here before but I'm definitely not ordering from here again!
author: Sarina A.

description:
This is probably one of the worst online order experiences I've ever had. It's drastic to say but goodness, it was an absolute mess. 

I placed an order for delivery, quoted 30-45 minutes. I called to confirm but couldn't get a hold of the restaurant. I called over the span of an hour to no avail I actually had to visit the restaurant. 

Upon arrival, I explained the length to which I had to go through in order to attain an answer. They disregarded my comment, gave a blank apology, didn't confirm whether or not my order was supposed to be delivered. Then they asked if they should deliver my order which to me was an unnecessary question since I am now physically at the location. 

To top of it off, they quoted me an additional 30-45 minutes without regard to the time when the order was placed. From observation, I can see they ignore all their phone calls. I can clearly see that they have no regard to answer not a single one. I had hoped the reviews weren't correct about the quality of the food since my friend gave me personal testimony about a previous experience but this was already proving to be questionable. 

I support small business but experiences like these are so discouraging. I also attempted to contact Eat24 support for over an hour without an answer.

Update: 
When I finally received the order, there was no confirmation of my order quantity. I placed a $90 order. They also didn't provide a receipt which I needed to confirm what they gave me was what I ordered. They randomly placed my food on the table I was sitting at and left very quickly. No acknowledgement for the unexpected difficulty.

Update:
The order was half right, missing items, and has wrong choice of protein in two items. I didn't try to contact the place, since they obviously won't answer their phones and I wasn't going to take another Lyft back.
author: Deji S.

description:
Good food and okay service. The delivery hours are inconvenient and listed wrong on the app, which they know but for some reason haven't changed. 

The green curry is a must, and you can't go wrong with any of their fried rice dishes. It's nice to see a Thai restaurant with so much other stuff on the menu that's as good as the staple dishes are. I feel like their knack for flavors is at its best when you order "very spicy," so don't hold back on the heat. This place is slowly becoming a go-to spot for me, but I had to dock them a star since I've had an issue with every order I've placed with them (slow delivery, wrong order received, etc) and it's really, really hard to communicate with them on the phone, which exacerbates the service issues.
author: Jay S.

description:
I'm a big fan of their Foster City location, in particular the Pad See Ew and those perfect pan fried noodles. 

So of course I would find myself at Sweet Basil on a jaunt to the area to cat sit at a friend's place who's common area smelled of delicious Thai food and sent my stomach into mad fit of hunger. 

Despite its Mission location, I snagged one of many parking spots right in front of the resto. 

Inside is small but cute for what would otherwise be a very casual dining experience. 

It took a few minutes for our server to get to us, but we came in late in the evening when all the tables who'd probably arrived an hour and a half earlier during the dinner rush were all closing out and had the attention of the staff. It wasn't a big deal but I could tell my dining partner was on the verge of having a no-chill moment for having to wait a few. 

When our server did come to take our order he apologized and was nice as can be. And then when he came back to bring our food and we were joking about something strange like thumbs and b-holes, he didn't give us weird eyes and instead joined in to give his genuine 2-cents on thumbs and butts and judging from how he left the table and then came back a few minutes not specifically to check on us, but to make a correction to his former Ts & Bs statement. 

Our food... it was good. It always is at Sweet Basil. I think my Pad See Ew was far saltier here than it ever is at the Foster City location, but it only took a few bites for my sodium levels to adjust and to power through almost fully (because their portions are extremely generous) until there was no more real estate left in my stomach.
author: Candice G.

description: Came here all the time.  Brought the family out after  Aladdin play.   We ordered soy sauce and after scooping it out with a spoon we noticed a fly on the rice.   They acted like it was not a big deal.  I was not happy after seeing this.
author: Kyle M.

description:
I live in SF and frequent many Thai Restaurants, todate this is my favorite. 
The food is delicious  , 
Pricing is good, highly recommend it.
author: Olga P.

description:
I've never actually eaten at the restaurant, but I've gotten takeout from here several times now. I don't know about the slow delivery times that other reviews mentioned, but they're pretty quick with takeout (~20 minutes).

I haven't really ventured out of my comfort zone here though, mostly sticking to the pad see ew, pad woon sen, pad khee mao, and spring rolls. The noodle portions are large!! Definitely enough for 2 meals. The pad khee mao tends to be pretty spicy actually, surprisingly! It's more of a jalapeno heat kind of spicy though, rather than the typical chili sauce spiciness. Everything I've ordered has been pretty good for a neighborhood Thai restaurant. My only tiny complaint it that they could put more / a greater variety of vegetables in the noodle dishes.
author: Tiffany P.

description: This was my third time at this place.  The first two times were pretty good but this last time, about a month ago, was not that good.   The portions are small but the bill wasn't.  Also, the food was very bland.   The Sweet Basil in Foster City is much better.  Must be a better chef.  I'll stick with the one in Foster City.
author: Bob L.

description: The red curry was delicious. I split the clear noodle salad with chicken with my friend and while the flavors were incredible (spicy and tangy), the texture of the shredded chicken threw us off a bit.
author: Alison B.

description: One of my favorite places to eat. They sometimes take a while to take your order but worth tge wait.
author: Maria V.

description:
I had my doubts, to be honest, but I was blown away by everything about my experience at Sweet Basil.

We walked over on Friday evening, and nearly msised the place as the signage is not too visable, but we found it anyway and went in. The wait staff was incredibly accomodating and kind, the ambiance was chill, classy. The music was a little off - sounded like karaoke music without the words, they should throw on some old jazz in my opinion. 

Happy hour was still going on (till 8!) so we both got their $1.99 beers. We ordered the Fish Cake ($7.95) which was flavorful, lightly fried, and served on a bed of red onions, carrots, and zucchini, with a vibrant purple orchid flower for garnish on top. 

For our entrees, I had the Green Curry ($8.99) which I always get at Thai places, but I ordered it with pork rather than chicken, which proved to be a good choice. The meat was fresh and tender. I also requested for it to be extra extra spicy and our waiter was so awesome, telling me he just got in some Thai chilis in that morning and offered to chop some up and throw them in my dish. It was *very* spicy, just the way I wanted it to be, but my friend started sweating while he ate. 

He ordered the Chef's Suggestion Bangkok Duck ($13.95). I personally liked my curry better, but he seemed to like the duck, as he ate the whole thing. I had a piece but it was a little sweet for my taste. No dessert for us, and the bill came to about $36 before tip. Seriously good all around, can't wait to go back or order delivery with my $5 off coupon from Grub Hub.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Had friends into town that wanted Thai food.
Basil Thai not only has great food but an elegant atmosphere with linen naps and tablecloths all with very reasonable prices.

Oh, and did I say a warm and friendly staff.
author: Gerald w.

description:
I have to make this a general review. We've never eaten in the restaurant...it's always been carry-out or delivery.

We've ordered from here several times and have tried many items on the menu, always trying to find something that is worth ordering again.
It hasn't happened. Everything we've had is just ok... we've kept giving them chances because of the convenience.  There are much better options in the city.
author: Zoran L.

description:
I ordered delivery via Eat24 a day in advance, and the delivery guy for Sweet Basil Thai showed up exactly on-time!!  All the items I ordered were included, servings were ample, and each was absolutely DELICIOUS!!!  

I ordered Chicken Yellow Curry with a side of Jasmine Rice, and was very pleased that the rice wasn't gummy and the curry was very flavorful and full of chicken!  My only comment here is that while I ordered "mild", it still had a strong kick to my taste buds...if you're someone who is sensitive to spice as I am, be forewarned that mild doesn't really mean that it doesn't have any heat to it!

I also ordered Pork Thai Fried Rice (Mmmm!) and Chicken Pad Thai.  My friends and I agree that both were delicious!

I will definitely order from here again!!
author: Amy L.

description:
Been here before and food is good (spicy too), but beware with delivery.

EVERY THAI SPOT IN SF GIVES YOU WHITE RICE W/ENTREES. SWEET BASIL THAI DOES NOT. 

You would think this is something that WOULD be expressed in their menu or told to you when you order.....
author: Static J.

description:
This is for delivery, not dine-in. 

Ordered a pad-thai with shrimp and chicken. It was dry, bland, and flavorless; possibly worst pad-thai I've ever had. Shrimp was good, but everything else - noodles, tofu, etc. - was meh.

I'm not super picky, but would not order from here again.
author: Sergey P.

description:
Never had a bad experience at this restaurant except for the one time when they told me they were closing and will not serve us at exactly 10 o'clock. Other than that all the food is awesome and the people are very nice not to mention the prices are very reasonable and it's pretty cute inside the restaurant. Good date place for thai

Get the seated ahi tuna appetizer it's unbelievable.
author: Jeremy R.

description: Vegan of three years, vegetarian of twelve, I started drinking chicken soup after clicking the option for Vegan, thrilled to dig in. So I did, unfortunately for me. Good tofu satay, tasty, but the meal ruined my afternoon. I don't know if it was an honest mistake they've only made once or if this restaurant should be avoided by vegans and vegetarians despite the description as veg-friendly.
author: Mia S.

description:
I ordered through Eat 24  I live about a half mile away.  They are now 45 minutes past the time they said they would deliver.  Making it coming upon 2 hours since I ordered.  They said the driver left 30 minutes ago.  We live 2 minutes away.  NEVER AGAIN!!
I feel bad just yelling at the delivery driver, but then looking through my food, the pad eggplant on the website menu is different than the pad eggplant on the delivery menu.  I was looking forward to my veggie ground chicken.  It came with tofu instead.  Grrrrrrrr.....
author: Opk H.

description:
The day I become vegan is the day I decide to be a born again virgin. Well, we know that ain't happening seeing how much I love sausages. (Hi Dad, if you happen to be reading...don't worry, I mean Vienna sausages.)

Formerly Thai Idea (second location), a vegan and vegetarian restaurant, Sweet Basil Thai is their carniwhorous sister restaurant by the same owners according to the staff. They still have faux meat available for all their dishes but decided to change their name since they offered meat dishes. Sweet Basil also has a location on Haight street and in Foster City. 

Sweet Basil is definitely a neighborhood restaurant in Bernal Heights as it's not a destination restaurant. Finding street parking is awfully frustrating if you come after 6 pm on the weekdays or anytime on the weekends. Since Safeway is across the street, you can always buy a pack of gum which then technically makes you a "customer" so you can park in the lot for 90 minutes. Just a thought but park there at your own risk. 

Just like Thai Idea in TL, you can count on the wonderfully friendly service, trendy and sleek atmosphere, and beautiful presented dishes at reasonable prices. The menu ($6.95-$16.95) has a good selection of soups, salads, appetizers, curries, entrees, seafood, noodles, and chef specialties but they seem to be more of Americanized dishes which is not surprising given the area. 

I love Thai Idea in TL so I thought I would love their carniwhorous sister even more especially since they also don't use MSG and have brown rice available (my review: http://bit.ly/1aWSTNo). Disappointingly, I wasn't a fan of Sweet Basil's meat and fish dishes because they weren't well executed. I probably would have liked their faux meat more assuming it's prepared like their sister restaurant in TL. 

As suggested by other Yelpers, we ordered the Massaman Curry ($8.95): http://bit.ly/1aWQYIH. We ordered it with duck for an extra $2. Deliciously rich, coconutty, and peanutty, the robust Massaman Curry was our favorite of the night. The duck could have been cut more thoroughly (pieces were stuck together) but it was very tender. This went very well with brown rice which soaked up all the yummy curry sauce. 

Unfortunately, things went downhill after this. The Volcanic Beef ($12.95) was pleasing to the eye but not the palate: http://bit.ly/1ce9q2A. There was no sear on the beef cubes making them incredibly chewy. I'm not a fan of OSHA Thai but I prefer their rendition over Sweet Basil's.

The Ginger Fish ($13.50) arrived on a bed of veggies with cornstarchy gravy: http://bit.ly/15bAe0w. There wasn't much ginger flavor but there were tons of button mushrooms, bell peppers, and onions. Just odd and not how I envisioned it based on the menu description. My biggest gripe was the batter they used; it was heavy and cakey which really compromised the delicateness of the fish fillets.

The wine started talking to me so the Fried Bananas w/ Ice Cream ($5.95) was ordered for dessert: http://bit.ly/18MWaOm. To be frank, it was just awful. The same heavy and cakey batter was used for coating the bananas and the accompanying ice cream was ultra icy and ironically wasn't creamy.

I hope they work out the kinks with their frying batter and meat preparation because they DO have an edge over their next door competitor (Pad Thai Restaurant) when it comes to faux meat options and using no MSG. IMO, it would be nice to see a couple of more popular and authentic Thai dishes like Ko Mu Yang: Grilled Pork Shoulder on the menu. Or even Sai Oua: Thai Sausage. I mean, who doesn't love a good piece of sausage?
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Not quite good enough, I don't expect this place to be around very long.  Not as good as Pad Thai up the street (or as good as Dusit which it replaced).  Tom yum was small, lame, no complexity, not sure what was wrong but it definitely wasn't happening.  Green curry was uninteresting.  Maybe they were having an off night, but probably won't be back.
author: Sammy B.

description:
I don't have a choice.  I have to give Sweet Basil 5 stars...

It was Tuesday night.  I'd been craving Thai food all day, but couldn't decide if I should give in or make something @ home instead.  I finally decided to just go for it.  But now it was almost 9:30...
I call in to see if it's too late to place an order for pick up, since they close at 10:00.  The gentleman that took this call suggested delivery.  Problem was we are out of their delivery range.  He then says they'll deliver it anyway, if I don't mind a small delivery fee.

Of course I don't mind.  I don't mind at all.

He says...
Why not stay nice & warm at home?
No rushing.  No driving.  No parking (on mission?  That's a laugh)...just relax & let them take care of it?  Uh...is this a trick question?  You don't have to ask me twice!

He then tells me he'll put my order in pronto, & that we'll be the last delivery of the night...no biggie.

Why can't everyone be this accommodating & everything be this easy?

The food arrived @ 10:00!  What?!  And everything was correct...
Duck egg rolls.
Thai samosas.
Spicy basil pork.
Spicy fried rice w pork.
Jasmine rice.

If you like duck, you'll love the duck egg rolls.  If you love Indian samosas, you'll like these.  The Thai version are just smaller, without the peas in the filling, & a tad less spicy.  Delicious!  I wolfed down 2 of them before I even brought out the plates & silverware for crisake!  The basil pork was the only dish that I didn't find exceptional; the flavor was on point enough but it was way overcooked.  The spicy fried rice w pork was perfect.  Perfectly seasoned, perfectly spicy, perfectly moist.  It was so good I'm salivating just thinking about it.  We loved it.

This was the most personable phone order I have ever experienced.  This guy was downright charming.  Absolutely gracious.  He was funny.  He was sweet.  He didn't rush me.  Considering the fact that I called just a half hour before closing time on a sleepy weeknight, that is beyond impressive.  

So...
extraordinary phone side manner, lightening speed order to delivery time, & the food being above par, well...

That's why I have to give them 5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Just ordered for delivery via the Eat24 app; they got all my vegan requests correct, and they arrived in *half* the estimated time the app gave me! Delivery guy was really nice too. Good food, I ordered medium spicy but it could have been a little spicier for my taste, I'll try "spicy" level next time. :)
author: Mircat M.

description: Friendly attentive prompt service. Food quality is great. Prices are fair. You won't go wrong with this place.
author: Long C.

description: Only downside is extra with most meals don't come with rice and when you order over the phone, they don't ask you if you want any. So the few times I've ordered to go, I picked up my food and got home before I noticed I didn't get rice. So make sure to ask!
author: Andy F.

description:
I have to wonder about the legitimacy of some of these reviews... I've eaten here almost a dozen times now, and I have to put this review down to combat the absolutely disgusting Thai place that is a couple doors down "Pad Thai." DO NOT go there. If you're considering the two Thai places, go to Sweet Basil Thai. 

This is a very decent neighborhood Thai place. I wouldn't say it's the best Thai place in the world, but it's a great place to get take-out or stop by for a quick bite in the hood. 

First of all, they definitely know how to pack food. I've ordered noodles several times from here and they separate everything perfectly so that the noodles don't get too soggy. I mean, that is some ingenuity and thoughtfulness put into their take-out protocol. 

Plus they give you pretty big portions. We got green curry from this place and it came in a big soup container which ended up being two meals worth! It was loaded with pork and veggies too - not all sauce.

The tom yum noodle soup here is also quite good. This is my favorite thai dish, and although I wouldn't say it's the best I've had, it's a fine substitute for my tom yum craving. 

So yeah, I don't know why "Pad Thai" a couple doors down has 4 stars and this is only getting 3.5 right now, that's kind of sketchy. We went to "Pad Thai" once and since they are called "Pad Thai" I thought I"d try the pad thai. It was so sticky sweet - it was like candy noodles. Clearly, it was made for a less asian clientele. Had also gotten green curry with pork and the pork was like mystery meat... and not very much of it either - just a few pieces. Most of it was this neon green curry sauce... I'm not thai, but I don't think it's suppose to be that color.

Anyways, this review should be about THIS restaurant... and everything I've had here has been decent to good. I'm glad to have this as a neighborhood go-to restaurant, especially for take-out, though the service has been good when I've eaten here. 

As for people complaining about delivery - you have to wonder if it's really Sweet Basil's fault. I would go pick up my food 10 mins after placing my order and it's almost always ready or if not then waiting just a few minutes. I mean whenever I've used Eat24 or any delivery service, it always takes forever. It's just dumb to complain about this. Basically in this city if you want delivery, you should expect it taking an hour and half, that's always been my experience. Do they even have their own delivery person, or does Eat24 provide the delivery person? 

Anyhow, I think some people are entitled, especially in this city, and don't think about things, so just wanted to put that out there. Sorry, I'm a libra so I like to fight for justice. Just not for the justice of that "Pad Thai" restaurant down the street. :P Sorry dudes.
author: Bonnie H.

description: After reading the reviews I tried to find another Thai restaurant that delivers and to my surprise there wasn't another option. As many reviewed the food is not good and I totally agree. I ordered chicken pumpkin & green curry, pork Thai basil and pad Thai. The curries were the worst I have ever had. They were thin, clear-like, no flavor, awful! It was the worst $70 I have spent all year, a real bummer. I may be spoiled, I live in Oakland where the food never disappoints.
author: Amy K.

description:
FOUND A BUG IN MY FOOD 

I'm not going to lie- the food was great! I ordered a red curry dish and as I'm getting down to my last bite I find a bug that looks like a small cock roach. IM SO DISGUSTED! 

I called and they gave me a full refund and deeply apologized but I think future customers need to know that you may be getting bugs in your food! I will be calling the department of public health.
author: Jariah B.

description:
I got the food delivered. It was pretty tasty and they didn't take too long.
Will do it again
author: Joana W.

description: I used to LOVE this place.  Go to Thai.  The chef was super friendly, and the food impeccable.  Took my folks when they came to visit, and it was pretty ordinary.  We were all underwhelmed.
author: Marcus C.

description: I think this is one of the most underrated Thai restaurants in SF, and definitely in the Mission/Bernal/Noe area. The flavors are incredible, they have all the great standbys as well as more adventurous dishes, and you can get seriously spicy if you're into that. I've eaten here countless times and never had a bad meal. If you have a chance to eat-in, do! The decor is chic and tasteful and the dishes are presented beautifully. Plus the service is really nice, both for in-house dining and take-out.
author: Rachel D.

description:
This review is for delivery.

Ordered 2 Tom Kha chicken soup ($9.50), and 2 salad rolls ($8.50)

When I opened the bag I was disappointed as the containers of soup were about half full... for $9.50.  The soup was thin, and tasteless.  

Salad roles smelled as though the shrimp may be bad, but we were so hungry we ate them anyway.  Unfortunately, they fell apart as we picked them up so they were not freshly made ...it was as if they had sat in out all day. The peanut sauce that comes with the rolls was oily at top and thick sauce...again as if it had sat out all day.

In addition it took 1.5 to get delivery - in driver's defense, it was raining and I felt bad for her as she said she was the only delivery person.  

The rolls and and soup went down the drain after spending $43 for food+delivery+ tip.  Not happy and won't be back.....
author: Heather S.

description:
I had a queasy stomache after eating here.  This is the first time in years.

The pineapple fried rice was mushy.  The usual dishes didn't look the same as other Thai restaurants - something with the sauce and texture.  

The seafood dish portions were decent side for $15.  

Soup portion were large.  

I wanted the panna cotta for the dessert art since I saw that on othe yelp post, but they didn't have it.  The only item was the mango sticky rice - that was good.  

If you want the rice or noodle dishes, you definitely can get better at other restaurants for the same price.  I don't know how they didn't get these dishes right.

Wait staff was smiley and polite, but super slow.  Although this place is small and well staffed, they always looked so busy, so I couldn't even flag them down because they would walk/look away too fast.  Waited for 30 plus mins after dessert to get the bill.

The entire time at this restaurant, looking at the food and the other customers, I was thinking why am I here?
author: Gloria T.

description:
Food is good. My only issue is there is no consistency in the spiciness of the food. I had a couple of times order the same dishes with the Spicy option, with the spiciness almost non existent. 
I just ordered the same dishes with the "very spicy" option and now they are impossible for me to eat as every bite makes me drink a bottle of water.
author: Roberto H.

description:
Decent place. The food has average flavors and definitely not worth the price tag. Nothing popped at all.

I had the Pad Thai, and other folks had the Crispy Chicken over Rice. Our Pad Thai was brought out a good 10+ minutes before the chicken, so we didn't quite eat together. Quiet atmosphere. 

Over all, pass on this place for lunch. There's many better places throughout the city and nearby, even.
author: Ricardo H.

description:
AN ODE TO SUNDAY SLUGS

The Sleepy slug was snoozing.
The Hungry slug wanted Thai.
The Interwebs provided options.

The Delivery was fast.

The Spring Rolls were kinda small.
The Papaya Salad was NOT "mild."
The Pad See Ew was nothing special.

but 

I DID NOT HAVE TO PUT ON PANTS.
author: Amy C.

description: Sherry, the host & waitress is super sweet!!! This is now my new favorite Thai Restaurant in the Daly City/SF area. Food is excellent and affordable although I only tried two dishes: Prawn & Avocado Curry ($16) and Pad Kee Mow ($11). Food presentation is pretty and the restaurant is decorated with pillows & fresh flowers. I liked the ambiance and service. Tell Sherry to take photos of you & your party, she's a low-key photographer who will truly brighten you experience :)
author: Sara O.

description: Great food and awesome staff very nice! Had a craving for Thai food. And found the spot in the mission in the heart of San Francisco. Sweet Basil Thai Cuisine is flavorful and presentation was good as well. Came here for lunch, can't wait to come back for dinner. Yummy for my tummy!! $
author: FoodieBy T.

description:
That was the least satisfactory Thai (or any) meal I've ordered for delivery in a very long time.  Bad enough to write a review for the first time in a long time as well.

First time customer, found and ordered via Caviar.

I kept it simple.  Three standards I generally try at a new to me Thai choice.  The larb gai, the dish I was craving most, was inedibly spicy and I'm no novice nor averse to heat. So disappointing since if it'd even been simply good, I'd not be writing such a review.  Hard to know for sure since I didn't get past first bite and it's more of a subtle issue, but the chicken seemed undercooked as well.  And again, not a novice.  I cook a lot of chicken in a lot of ways and know the line between perfectly juicy but done and undercooked.

OK, on to a usually comforting dish to me, yellow curry with chicken and onions. Boring and sad.  This was slapped together and lacked any depth of expected flavors in the coconut based yellow curry.  The onions were nicely tender and not mushy but the potatoes were grainy.  Probably russets and maybe should be something like a Yukon gold?

I should note here that I had this over rice.  But there was no option to order rice. I added it as a note to the order but I fault the restaurant for not adding side rice choices to their Caviar setup. But I give them credit for noticing the note I added.

Last, I often add tom yum soup to any Friday night Thai order to have it in fridge for lunch or a dinner starter Saturday.  I'm not eager to find out what it's like but it can't possibly make this review better.

Sadly submitted.
author: Jon R.

description:
I haven't even eaten yet, but 5 stars. Great ambiance, music, and iron chef DVD on the television. 

Food has arrived: love the peanut sauce (I've been missing some good peanut sauce), and the California rolls delivered in a martini glass. Great all around.
author: Johnathon S.

description:
I like their rice dishes here, but their pad-thai was just so terrible compared to other thai restaurants in the Bay Area! Also their green curry tasted really bizarre. 

On the plus side, they have delivery options, which I thought were helpful and convenient, but The workers there (I thought) were friendly, till one day I had a voicemail left by accident by a couple of the workers talking rudely about my order about how I hadn't tipped enough for such a large order, which BTW I couldn't change because I ordered through yelp, so I was planning to tip by cash at the door. That's a Big FLOP on their part...

Anyhow, two stars for convenience, but for taste, and service it was so-so. eh.
author: Sophie P.

description: This place is just okay.  I've eaten here a couple times and never been upset, per say, but have always felt like there's something lacking.  It kind of seems like for them spice = how hot the food is, rather than how flavorful.
author: Kyle W.

description: I ordered the basil chicken through UberEats.  I can't comment on the decor, the staff, or the inside, or anything else, but my meal came through in less than 30 minutes, even during dinner hours, and it was perfectly cooked, seasoned, and spiced.
author: Sarah R.

description: If there is ZERO STAR, i would def give it. Bad quality food ever. I ordered noddle soup with duck. They gave me all duck skin. The taste like shits.
author: Telsa K.

description:
Meh... Nothing special really. Full-disclosure: I've never eaten at the restaurant. Only had take-out once before and I don't remember being disappointed last time around. Maybe they were having an off night. Who knows... Anyway, last night we went the Eat24 route again and had the salad rolls, Tom Kha Gai soup and Pad See Ew. Granted, these aren't the most exotic items on the menu, but every dish was totally bland. 

The Salad Rolls had almost no taste at all and the peanut sauce that came with them was slightly better than dipping into a jar of Jiffy. The soup was a bit boring. Luckily, we had some limes so we were able bring it a little closer to Tom Kha Gai we're used to. And the Pad See Ew was just OK. 

I'm willing to give them another shot though given all the other glowing reviews. Again, Maybe they we're having an off night.
author: Adam M.

description: The price is reasonable and the service is good. I like the location and easy pickup if you park one block up or down from the restaurant. Great people and nice service.
author: Nilu S.

description:
I have been looking for a great Thai in the city for a while. The Thai samosa, chicken yellow curry and chicken fried rice are great!
The service was also super. The ambience is inviting and nice. Definitely a place in my list.

We came here again and now we had the pineapple fried rice, amazing as any other food!
author: Marcia d.

description:
Good neighborhood Thai restaurant! The staff is really friendly, it's got a bit more atmosphere than the other Pad Thai place down the street, and the food is pretty darn good for Asian eats in this part of the city. I've ordered some curries and noodle dishes (pad see ew, pad Thai, pumpkin curry are my favorites). 

For a place that's so homey and authentic, I was pleasantly surprised at not only the decor, but also how PRETTY each dish was when it came out! They had little orchids, sauce drizzling, ornamental lettuce leaves. Presentation was really nice.
author: Amanda A.

description:
I love their food!!!

I always order pineapple fired rice to be my dish! The portion is so huge and so delicious and I can ask them to change cashew nuts to be bell peppers too (I'm allergy to nuts).

I didn't like their deep fried things very much but overall is ok.

The service mostly nice just only sometimes were bad.
author: Neng P.

description:
I live close by and even then I'd say it's one of the best Thai spots in the city. Plus the people who work here are really sweet. :) And the pricing ain't bad. 

They don't mess around with spices for the properly spicy dishes (as any legitimate thai place should). The first time I came here I ordered the pad kee mao and it was so spicy that I teared up. The waitress noticed and comped a thai iced tea to help me take it! I always take my spicy loving friends here.
author: Deanne C.

description: Owner was nice enough to call me back and reconcile the situation. I think it would have tasted better if I ate it fresh at the restaurant.
author: Ada A.

description:
Our go-to Thai restaurant in SF/Daly City. I'd give it 4.5 if I could for being good at everything we've tried. Very good maybe. I have had better Thai, but not in Northern CA.
Also, the manager is the friendliest guy. I'd go back just to hang with him again. I like supporting their business.
If they were open much later (we're super late-owls, and love to eat very late, especially after some drinks in the Mission), we'd probably go at least once a week (hint, hint to restaurant: stay open late for that late night crowd, if you want).
author: Erin M.

description:
This is HANDS DOWN THE BEST THAI FOOD IN SF! Their curries have so many levels of flavors. I have tried many different Thai places in the city and nothing compares to this one. The yellow curry is amazing and so is the Pumpkin Curry. Their Thom Ga Khai soup is delicious. 

The best part is: they deliver. It can take an hour an a half when they are busy, so order ahead. However, it is well worth the wait.
author: Lana S.

description:
I would love to rate this place with a legitimate star, but I can't. Right now this will sit at 1 star for denying us right before 10pm when your hours say you're open until 10:30pm on a Friday.

If you don't want business after 10, then set your closing hours to 10. Simple as that.

There were 4 in the party, if that helps people understand the review better. Only 1 of us was going to actually eat, though.
author: Taylor G.

description:
First of all, the good stuff... My first order through Yelp. Easy order process. The order came quickly, and the pineapple fried rice was good. 

Unfortunately, the rest of the review isn't as favorable. We ordered string been with chicken while we indicated mild spice, the restaurant completely ignored our request. And then they insinuate that we are an idiot for ordering something that is supposedly spicy and then telling them not to make it spicy. Well, this idiot won't be ordering anything from them anymore. And their manager isn't doing them any favors by treating their customers the way he does...

Then I get a call from Yelp telling me that since I complained, they are black listing me from this restaurant and their app.

Unbelievable...
author: David C.

description: I've gotten both takeout and delivery from here and have enjoyed the food every time. I especially like their curries and noodle dishes. The service isn't the friendliest but the food does come out quickly.
author: Diana G.

description: I called for Togo food . Then the ladies who picked phone call was alwful, i just called for 2 orders . Then she makes me waiting on the phone line like 40seconde n without any reply !its totally  unrespectable to ppl !!!
author: Eileen W.

description: We had our meals delivered to us. The delivery time was on schedule.  However, some of the dishes we ordered was not good. I had better at other Thai restaurants. We ordered, Wing of Love, which was over cooked, dried and hard to eat. There wasn't much meat on them. The Shrimp rolls were tiny, one bite and it was gone.  It was soft, not crunchy as I thought it would be. The pad see-ew was mushy, it was over cooked as well. The only dish, I liked was the Pumpkin curry. It was on point.
author: Toi E.

description:
When my friend described this small Thai restaurant with fervent enthusiasm, I was ready to be skeptical. After all, Thai food has certainly let me down before. Nonetheless, I was blown away by the quality and price of Sweet Basil. I've eaten my way through the noodle portion of the menu, but now I've settled on the Pad Woosen (silver/glass noodles with egg, mushrooms, etc). I'm not sure how they're able to stay in business with such low prices, but enjoy it while they're low!

Next time I'm back in SF, I will most definitely be stopping by this place. Lunch, dinner, leftovers for breakfast, I could eat Sweet Basil all day long.
author: Irene C.

description: AMAZING FOOD AND ENVIRONMENT! My friend had to twist my arm to come here and I'm so grateful that I did. I eat out all the time so it's hard to impress me. BIX, French Laundry and Saison are just some of the places I've eaten and if I had a choice to go back to either one I would pick here.. I'm serious. I'm not sure about these crappy reviews. See for yourself.
author: Scott S.

description: Ordered food at 830pm, unaware they close at 9. They quoted me a 90 minute delivery time. I was not happy about this length of time, but agreed hesitantly. They took my payment in full, but food never arrived.
author: Steve D.

description: Pretty poor version of Thai food. Lacked flavor or the heat. Came here on a recommendation instead of going to Marnee Thai. Guess should have stuck to my research.
author: Jit D.

description:
Good food, good price I think this is best Thai restaurant around mission.
Because food are very Thai
author: Sakrapee R.

description:
Decided to order from here via Eat24 on the basis of the relatively good reviews, and order online option. 

I've had a lot of Thai, and never experienced such bland Tom Kah coconut soup. There were generous mushroom and chicken portions in the soup, but it was unremarkable.

Worse, was the string beans with chicken. There has never been a spicy Thai dish that has been too spicy for me, except this one. It arrived so spicy I am unable to eat it at all. Either this was an accident on part of the kitchen, or there needs to be a big update to the menu on how spicy this dish is. 

In any case, this was a big disappointment.
author: Joann K.

description: The most boring and flavorless Praram that I've ever tasted. Meh.
author: Charles L.

description: Ordered delivery from here on eat24 and was really pleasantly surprised.  I ordered the duck with glass noodles (woonsen duck), the eggplant with tofu, and the tom yum veggie  (which is a consommé with a ton of vegetables).  The food was really delicious and it lasted me several meals because the portions are so big!   Total before tip was $35.  Definitely ordering from here again.
author: Vivian W.

description: My husband and I went here for lunch. We were greeted and we took a table. We placed our order of shrimp pad thai, chicken green curry and pork ginger pad ginger. Our order was beautifully presented. The food had fresh ingredients and very flavorful. The portions were perfect. They had brown rice which was a plus for my husband. Service was great- our glasses of water were never empty. We found a place to go to when we want Thai food.
author: CC S.

description:
We stumbled upon this restaurant by chance... And now it has become our go-to restaurant if we're being incredibly indecisive. 

Massaman curry, I loveeee it. 

Of the times we've been here, Sweet Basil has been awesome! Great staff who remembered our face and quick service. Don't know what's up with all the bad reviews (seems to be a take-out problem) but that's okay, keeps this hidden gem hidden!
author: Shannon W.

description:
Arguably the best Christmas dinner party we've ever had at Cole Hardware Mission.  Plenty of affordable booze, comfortable seating, and attentive service...The service was probably what I expected and enjoyed the most.  They really impressed us with how quickly the food came flying out of the kitchen.

We had a chance to sample the whole entire menu and I can honestly say everything was cooked to perfection.  My favorites include the spring rolls, salads of any type, curries, and even the pad thai seem to taste better than usual.  Their plates are not only tasty but also nice to look at.

Thanks for dinner Rick Karp, owner/keeper of the karma Cole Hardware!!!
author: Randy L.

description: The service was A+ was really treated well. The dish I ordered was excellent and there was plenty to eat. I really appreciate that there was a mix of veg and meat not just a bunch of chicken. Rice was perfect. It was a pleasant, classy restaurant. The server was extremely friendly and nice and that made the visit much more pleasant.
author: Will D.

description:
I ordered on GrubHub again and was hoping for some kick butt thai food. We chose Sweet Basil because I tried their Massaman Curry and it was amazing. 

When the food arrived it wasn't what we expected so I contacted GrubHub. And within 15mins Grubhub contacted the owner and then me. They offered to have a second order sent in 20mins but I said it wasn't neccessary.

Then my doorbell rings 5 mins later, opened the door and I guy had more food for us. It was the chef himself! He was so passionate about making sure that his customers were happy and cooked it personally watching over every detail. I have never had such an amazing customer service experience like this before in my life. Im so shocked, and speechless at the service. Absolutely impeccable. I wish more restaurants dropped their egos and followed in the foot steps of Chef Allan(sp?) and the Sweet Basil team, putting the customers first.

THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU
author: Mario M.

description: Worst place to get delivery from unless u have minimum 2 hrs to wait to get food.  I live 1 mile away and last 2 deliveries have taken 2 hrs...
author: christopher h.

description:
My review is exclusively for the delivery experience - I unfortunately have not had the chance to try Sweet Basil Thai b/c they canceled my delivery order 1 hour after I had placed it. 

I get that demand probably spikes for most SF restaurants over the holiday weekend; but if you're too busy to honor a delivery order, then please don't wait until 9pm to let me know. 

I'm sure the food is amazing - I was really excited to try it. Sadly, I don't think that will be happening any time soon.
author: Tiffany H.

description: This place is soooo good, it deserves its 5 stars! It's our second time here and everything was delicious, again! Service is also great, everyone is so nice... We will definitely come back!
author: Stav W.

description:
Hi! I'm Penny PA, a film industry Office PA who rates the best & worst places to buy your office lunch. My review, like all my reviews, is based on the experience of ordering for a large group of people - in this case, 50 folks.

Hands down, this is the best restaurant I've *ever* ordered crew lunch from. I call them with an urgent order for same-day delivery, and Alan tells me it's no problem at all, he helps me figure out exactly how much I need of each dish, and how we can fit it into our budget ($12 per head). They happily deliver (not even by request, they offer to do it), and help us unload & set up the food when they arrive.

The pad kee mao is TO DIE FOR, even better than the pad see ew. The crispy rolls are amazing too, and the red curry with beef. The mixed vegetables weren't a huge hit, a few too many bean sprouts... but overall, this place ROCKS.

Can't recommend it enough.
author: Penny P A.

description: Great place for an early dinner with friends and our toddler. Good food watch out for the 'spiciness' level!
author: Aspasia I.

description: Vegetarian and Vegan options with Soy Thai Ice Tea, even! Delicious for your whole group, drink specials, great ambience (and I never say that.)
author: Kathleen A.

description: I really like this place a lot, sad thing is. The hours on yelp are not the same. I called and the mailbox is full.  Please update info so that the locals have the right info.
author: Rudeazz G.

description:
Favorite new go-to place for Thai Food in the Mission/Noe area!  I ordered several appetizers and two entree's for 2 hungry adults, 1 kid and had a lot of left-overs.  Very generous portion sizes for all of the dishes. 

Food was excellent.  Tom Yum Seafood soup was delicious and had a great broth (awesome remedy for sickness or hangovers).  Seafood Delight had a great variety of seafood and was delicious.  Green Curry with chicken - another hit.  We didn't go wrong with any of the dishes we ordered.  All excellent.

Very glad I stumbled across this place on Yelp and will definitely be returning to try other items on the menu (especially the Fire Cracker Balls - that caught my eye!)
author: michele g.

description:
Very disappointed 
Ordered through eat24

Coconut soup - very mediocre 
Spring rolls - generic 
Pad thai - no flavor 
Basil tofu -ok 

Phucket fish - horrible 
Fish was poor quality and fried to the point it was like beef jerkey 
Thought it might be salvageable with the amazing sounding sauce that came with it - NOPE - sauce tasted like biting into ginger 

For the price I can get fresh well made food elsewhere
author: Karen H.

description: This is one of my favorite thai spots in the city , always very happy and excited when I make the visit here and the service is awesome !!
author: Javier G.

description:
We read the previous reviews and ordered shrimp pad Thai, Tom Kha Gai, and Pra Ram tofu, for delivery.  The quality of the food is just horrible for the price and the high rating:

- The pad Thai is gooey, broken noodles, with no flavor.

- The chicken in Tom Kha Gai is so tough that my gum hurts just from chewing one piece and I am not an old lady.  There is sand in the mushroom, is it washed?

- The worst is the Pra Ram tofu, they did not give it to me, instead, it is some "made-up dish", soft tofu in spicy coconut soup with some red pepper.  What is that?  
Yeah, I did not check when the deliver guy came, due to my sprained ankle and growling stomach.  But he asked for delivery fee for his gas.  From Bernal Height to Dolores St is how far?

Maybe they treat you better when you eat in, but the quality of take-out, esp. delivery worth no more than 1 star.
author: Yi Z.

description:
This place has a solid selection of traditional Thai food plus some good fusions.  Over all quality of food is high and their portion sizes are generous. The waitstaff is excellent.  Very friendly and attentive. I've not had as good service there from any other Thai restaurant in the mission.  Make sure to specifically ask for the spice level because they serve their spicy food HOT! It is Thai hot. Which is to say don't order spicy unless you mean it. Their mild food was well flavored without the oppressive heat. 
The noise level was quiet / normal, though the restaurant was not very full any time I've been.
author: Dennis M.

description:
Beware, everything is spicy by default. 

Love that they have mock meats - perfect for the vegetarian. The plates were still tasty and the mock meats helped the dish not feel lacking. 

The server was attentive, but only checked in at the appropriate times. They helped us pack up our food to take home.
author: Jane N.

description:
My aunt was in town visiting from Maryland, and she found this restaurant online and suggested it for a lunch destination for our family. I frequent King of Thai Noodle, so I wasn't too keen on going out of our way (there is one right near the house) to go to a different Thai restaurant, but WOW am I glad she made the recommendation!
It is a bit more of a fusion restaurant. There are tons of vegan and vegetarian options. It is very, very affordable. The food was outstanding and the waitress was super friendly. Everything we ordered was delicious, and all five dishes were seasoned very differently. Often, I feel like I'll order various dishes and the only thing that changes are the vegetables in the dish...which was not the case here. Super different flavor profiles. 
Definitely recommend this place, especially if you're vegetarian or vegan!
author: Leila-Anne C.

description:
Best Thai food in SF.  And I actually lived in Bangkok for a year, long ago, so I do know what I am talking about.  

Get the cucumber salad.
author: Aaron J.

description:
To all uniformed personnel, this establishment is Law Enforcement friendly.

Now that that's been said, the staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. My partner and I were looking for a thai place on mission because our usual spot was closed. As a result, we wandered in Sweet Basil. 
Immediately, the manager--I assume--greeted us, warmly. He even gave us chilled bottles of water to take with us because we were ordering to go.
The prices are fair, the food quality is excellent, and the quantity is generous.

Realizing that we pretty much always have to order our food to go, the staff informed us that you can also place an order online. An added bonus to the already perfect eatery.
author: Chris Y.

description:
This is my new favorite Thai place

Basil eat your heart out. 

Big portions, delicious and beautiful presentation.
author: Chris H.

description: Love their ahi tuna appetizer. The sweet basil seafood was okay. Not impressive at all. The beef tasted old and it was hard to chew. The environment is pretty good.
author: Jie C.

description:
I have eaten at sweet basil Thai for more than a year and always their food.

The manager used to be a complete psychopath but fortunately there parted ways with him and return to their former standards of excellence in both customer service and fine cuisine.
author: Jeff G.

description:
I ordered for delivery two times and wasn't pleased with it.

First time I ordered, delivery was free, cool. Second time, I was told that I wasn't in their area and needed to pay more. Okay, a little inconsistency there. I wouldn't be so bothered if the Pad Thai wasn't so nasty and chewy. To be honest, I was utterly disappointed as I thought their signature dish would be "safe" to order. Guess not. Literally the worst pad thai I've had so far and that's saying a lot since I am an avid fan of thai food!

I do like their pad-see-ew though. That was decent. What I liked most so far would be their Sweet Basil dish.

Also, don't order thai tea here. You will be disappointed. It's diluted with water with absolutely no taste :(

I was excited to find a thai place that actually delivers in the area, but I don't think I'd bother again. I'll just head out to downtown next time.
author: Phuong V.

description:
Fair warning: They do not mess around when you ask for your curry to be spicy. I've been to Thailand and am an adventurous eater (what's up, cockroach?), but these curries still rumbled my stomach and made my lips burn.


The beef salad was alright, but there were still bits of collagen and cartilage in many of the pieces. 


The green curry was good, but so spicy as to overpower the other flavors.
author: Ben M.

description: Ordered a delivery of the pineapple fried rice and panang curry with chicken, and upon pouring the curry and rice into my dish, I found a massive insect (bigger than a fly) stirred in the curry- Absolutely disgusting. I called the restaurant and got a full refund but I will not order from this place ever again. I wonder what their food inspection rating is? Dirty.
author: V Y.

description:
I've had Thai food in New York, Philly, Boston, SF, and Thailand and must say that this is as close as you'll get to the real deal! I ordered for delivery, and it arrived within 30 mins. 

Beef pad see ew - they use thinly sliced beef! Genius! No more of that overcooked meat that you eat around. Every bite was heavenly, flavorful, and moist (yep, a perfectly good adjective to describe a noodle dish!)

Tom yum soup - very authentic, except that it is very mild off the menu, so ask for more spice if that's what you like! 

Massaman curry - also very tasty, doesn't come with rice though, so you'll want to order that on the side. 

Guess I've found my go-to Thai spot in the city!
author: Michelle L.

description:
What a great place! Food is great, people are nice and welcoming, and the interior is tasteful and serene. 

I had the:
- Papaya Salad - delicious, spicy & sweet, fabulous start
- sweet Basil Chicken - very tasty! I wish I had some brown rice tho (see below)
- Salad Rolls ie. rice paper spring rolls - delicious! And loved the unique flavor of the peanut sauce!

There was a weird issue with their brown rice (they had to make it to order that night or something?), and white rice is bad for me, so I went without. Which was fine.

I look forward to coming back!
author: Michael D.

description:
When the menu was explained by the guy who seated us, I learned that everything could be had with a vegetarian version. Tofu "mock" meat. fish or seafood can be substituted, I said "The kitchen staff must have great patience", knowing how line cooks hate substitutes (waiters learn this quickly). Alan's response was, "I'm the chef and  you are my family. So whatever it takes to bring you a meal you'll enjoy, that's what we do."  That wasn't an empty promise. I ordered an eggplant dish with "mock" chicken and it was even better than chicken because the braised tofu retained the flavor of the sauce. Tremendous!

Also, the best Larb I have ever found! (I'm not total vegetarian)
author: Rick J.

description:
Sweet Basil Thai is some of the best thai in the area. 
The space is small, cute, modern-ish looking. The fountain was a nice touch.

For appetizers, we ordered the papaya salad and the fresh salad rolls. The papaya salad was very nice, but quite spicy. I wasn't expecting it, so my lips were tingling for a while! The salad rolls were so good, I ended up ordering them for my main course and so did another person at the table. The must have thought we were crazy ordering three orders of salad rolls. The peanut sauce was also so good, that I ended up eating all of the edible orchids dipped in peanut sauce. Yes, it was that good. Don't judge.

They also only serve one beer here. Thai beer, appropriately. Singha. And its pretty good!
author: Michael T.

description:
Ordered beef pad Thai, chicken pad Thai, and 2 Thai iced teas for delivery. Delivery took about an hour and I was only about half a mile away. The portions for the pad Thai were HUGE. I only ate about a quarter of it. As for the flavor... It was alright. Nothing amazing. The Thai iced tea was really good, but I could have gone without the unnecessary amount of ice that left me with half a cup of the drink itself.

I'll probably try the different Thai places around the area before I order from here again.
author: Allison M.

description:
Accommodating and quick service, especially considering we had an obnoxiously loud party that took up half of the restaurant. We went on a thursday and there was happy hour until 8 ($2 beers and ~$15 bottles of wine). However since most of the party didn't arrive until around 8, they applied the happy hour prices to our whole meal. They even closed down the restaurant about an hour early for us!

I ordered family style with a few others so was able to try the chicken pad thai, yellow curry chicken, fried rice, and a chicken skewer with peanut sauce appetizer. All were so flavorful and juicy and went perfectly with the Chang beer! I will definitely be back for happy hour after work one of these days :)
author: Mina C.

description:
Thought I had died and went to Thai food heaven.
So many layers of flavor.  Each dish prepared and presented with the precision I expected.
Kudos to Chef Allen and his staff.
You really have to just come here to really appreciate what he does.
author: Albert S.

description:
I just waited an hour and a half for my $50 delivery order. I called 7 times before the phone was finally answered after I had contacted eat24. While on the phone I was passed to three different people before someone stayed on the phone and told me it would be ANOTHER 40 MINUTES ontop of the 60 they told me and the additional 15-20 eat24 told me. Waiting over two hours for delivery that is less than a mile away is ridiculous. And what's more ridiculous is how long it took me to find out. 

I serve in a full service restaurant and I've worked in every other aspect of the restaurant industry, so I understand being busy and feeling overwhelmed. The way they handled the situation was just unacceptable. 

I'm just asking for honesty from the start! No matter how good the food I'll never order from here again.
author: Rachel J.

description:
Some customer service tips to the non-accented English speaker who took my call on Monday night (11/18). (Reading through the other negative customer service reviews, it is likely that this person is Allen, the manager, though I have no idea):

-If a customer has been waiting over an hour and a half for an order placed at the very reasonable time of 6:44 pm, and now it's 8:23 pm, and he's already called the online ordering service once to check to see why his order is so late, and they said it would be 5-10 minutes more, and then 15 minutes pass and still no food, that customer has a perfect right to be kind of annoyed. 

-Putting on super-fake bright affect, like saying "awesome!" when the customer reluctantly agrees to be put on hold, does not help at all. Tanking blood sugar levels mean that the customer is not having an "awesome" experience and just pretending like everything's totally "cool!" is likely to make the customer even angrier. 

-Invest in a proper hold button, or at least a mute button. When the customer can hear you trying to do damage control with the driver, it makes it that much harder to get that customer to believe you when you tell him that you're just "really busy."

-When the customer calmly asks you what went wrong, better to tell him the truth and then try to make it right instead of getting defensive and belligerent. Remember, he heard you talking to the driver. 

-When the customer starts to get angry at your ongoing deception and your refusal to make any effort at all to even apologize, and he suggests that you may want to just explain what really happened if you don't want to get some one-star reviews, you should probably go ahead and come clean instead of just repeating more loudly how much people "like your food." This customer likes your food too, and he found out from your extremely apologetic and polite driver that you fell behind on the Eat24 orders. That's not such a big deal. If you had just owned it instead of covering it up and then getting defensive about it, you might have found that your customer is actually a pretty rational and forgiving person. 

-Yelling at the customer that he is threatening "slander" is also not a good move. Here is the definition of slander: "the action or crime of making a false spoken statement damaging to a person's reputation." See that word "false"? 

Here are some facts: online ordering system reported that food would arrive in 45-60 minutes.  Food took 105 minutes to arrive. Customer received rude and incompetent service and repeated attempts to "spin" him instead of trying to resolve the situation. There was no apparent concern for acknowledging or rectifying mistakes.  

Having worked in the restaurant industry for some years myself, I can safely say that those facts are probably going to get you a bunch of one star reviews. 

I can only speculate, but your attitude and tone really indicated that you probably felt like you were "too good" to be taking customer complaints. Maybe that's not your strong suit; it's definitely a challenge, I know. I have no idea what your story is, but you certainly haven't taken your job seriously enough to figure out how to do it well. So, here's a free lesson, courtesy of the internet, on how to handle an irate customer:

1. Remain calm; don't reflect and amplify your customer's anger.
2. Empathize; if your customer has a valid reason to be angry, assure him that you understand his frustration.
3. Apologize; a simple apology goes a long way towards defusing heated situations.
4. Find a solution; a free appetizer or even a free meal will cost your business much less than a lost customer, and much, much less than a bad online review; you might even find that the proper response to a negative situation will not only result in a happy, paying, loyal customer, but glowing online reviews commending you for thinking fast and putting the customer first. 

Dude, you completely blew it on every single point. Maybe you've got plenty of customers already and can afford to p*ss a few of them off. Maybe only having four stars on Yelp instead of five is worth not learning how to do customer service properly. I don't know. Seems like you're doing a lot of things right already; why not all of them?
author: j. d. c.

description:
Walking past on our way to El Rio. This place is tremendous from top to bottom. Food was delicious, presentation amazing and the service outstanding. They seem to take everything into account on what makes a get dining experience. 
     Relaxing environment with great attention to detail.......Will definitely be coming back. .......very soon.
author: Drew Y.

description:
I only write reviews when Im mind blown or super unsatisfied. 

Best Thai place I've tried so far. And lots have disappointed me.
author: Mina S.

description:
I've ordered delivery from this location several times and unfortunately, I cannot give it as high of a rating as the other reviewers.  Two out of the 4 times I have ordered here I have found a hair in my food. Sorry, I know this is gross but it is absolutely true. I believe I ordered the pad thai both times I found the hair. I have also had the thai iced tea and it was good.

 On a positive note, I gave it a 2 instead of a 1 because the food was always delivered on time and the over-the-phone service was good. Perhaps I might give this place another try but it probably won't be a for a while.
author: Antoinette O.

description:
Ordered takeout for dinner and it was better than I expected -- flavorful dishes with very reasonable prices given the amount of food that came with each dish. This would have been a 5 star review but for how long it took given a pretty early (before 5pm) order time, and the fact that the Pad Thai was only so-so (both in terms of taste and textures). 

We ordered red and green curries. The curries are excellent, and have a good level of spice, which you can specify. The menu is also very vegetarian-friendly, although that's not unusual for Thai food.  The Pad See-Ew noodles were great, although the beef was only good. Good Tom Kha soup as well. 

I would definitely order from here again, although not if I was already super hungry.
author: Elaine S.

description: Great service and food, the food presentation is always great like a fine dining restaurant. Reasonable prices! Especially when it's lunch time. I love their Pad Ped, pad Thai is OK, I've had better pad thai's (Thai satay in San Mateo) but overall it's always a good experience when I'm here. The server is really nice and friendly, he always know I want brown rice even when j don't tell him. $7.99 for an entree with rice during lunch time.
author: Jomilyn T.

description: It was rather empty when we came in. The servers were very friendly and attentive. The food was fresh  and the mango with sticky rice was delicious!!!
author: Wildeflower M.

description: Some dishes were very good and others just okay. Noodle dish and pumpkin curry were great. Had the crab fried rice and wasn't a fan. Overall, good prices service and atmosphere.
author: Alina F.

description: Came at 10 on a Friday night and they said they were closed even if it said 10:30 because "the activity is slow" very disappointed!
author: Nacer K.

description: I was impressed. I wasn't sure at first because of the mixed reviews. This place is a standout. The service was terrific and extremely friendly. The food was fresh and tasty and the presentation alone gets 5 stars. They have a happy hour between 5 and 8, half off. We had the tofu satay and spring rolls, along with the Tom Yum Gai Soup and the Sweet Basil Pad Krapow (with tofu). We definitely will be going back. Prices are reasonable, too. P.S. I rarely give a restaurant 5 stars, reserving it for the "upper echelon" restaurants that flip my boat for the bucks.
author: Albert K.

description:
The service is nice when they're there, but I tried to call to order take out and no one picked up! Weird. When I got there at 8 PM, the place was nearly empty, and they seemed to be doing sidework in the dining area. Cute daughter in the corner playing on her iPad. In fact, all the servers were also very cute, polite, and friendly. This was probably the first time someone got me water to drink while waiting for take out, which didn't take that long at all in the first place.
