Very solid pad thai, even though I could barely eat any of it. Either my stomach is shrinking exponentially, or this is quite a large portion--or both! Not the sweetest or most flavorful... I'll be looking to add some sugar Thai-style next time!

I'm loving the free delivery; will definitely try that next time. Hope they enjoy the hike up to the top of Bernal Heights Hill!
author: Kimberly Y.

description: Have gone to eat-in here and ordered take out from here a few times- it is now my go to Thai place; used to order from pad Thai but prefer sweet basil now. Super friendly staff- food is tasty and fresh. Would definitely recommend. Not 5 stars- only because it does not blow your mind but it is good!!
author: Michelle D.

description:
Vegetarian review: This place is amazing. It is lovely inside, the servers are positively charming and very accommodating, and the food is simply beautiful and tastes superb. As I noted in the "Yelp Tips" section, they have a vegetarian menu that's as equally huge as the meaty one.

Their Volcanic Veggie-Beef is really outstanding, as is their Panang Curry with Veggie-Chicken. I have yet to try a single bad dish here, and I come here fairly often.

If I had to make a criticism, I'd say that they should hand out the fabulous vegetarian menu along with the meaty one--currently, you have to know to ask for it. Also, if you want a spicy dish, even when a dish is marked as spicy, you really need to request for it to be "very spicy" in order for it to give you a nice kick to the mouth. Regardless, I really adore this place, and am, admittedly, a bit of a Thai snob.

Love! Thanks for the great food, Sweet Basil Thai (formerly Thai Idea)!
author: Elle J.

description: Wow.  I ordered delivery and put in wrong phone number because I was starving.  They were out of one item I had ordered and tried to call but of course couldnt get through.  The delivery guy apologized profusely which was not needed since it was my fault for putting in wrong number.  As if that was not enough, they came back twenty minutes later with what I had ordered because he saw how disappointed my girlfriend was.  He went and got the ingredients and had the chef make it from scratch.  I will only order from them in the future.
author: seth r.

description:
It's hard to like food when it always comes 30-45 minutes later than the estimate, and thus cold. 

Fool me once, shame on you. 

Fool me twice, I should have learned from the first time. Jesus, hanger is real.
author: An B.

description: Food is really good ... Ahi tuna seared , green curry shrimp and Tom kha gai ... Would recommend to anyone
author: Bryan C.

description: It's very difficult to find a decent Thai place near my house.  I've given this place several opportunities to be a decent (not even good) Thai place.  The first order was pretty late and they included the end of the head of lettuce as garnish in my beef lime salad?   The 2nd order worse Rice noodles in gravy I'd ever had.  The 3rd order, I'm done.   They took 2 hours to get the order here, closed their restaurant and website and access to Eat24 hours,.  They actually disappeared from the Eat24 website.   So even though it was 1 1/2 Eat24 was saying it would be here in an hour.  They had 2 and 1/2 hours to get my order right and they still screwed it up.  Eat24 refunded me the item they "forgot" immediately.   Lousy and rude service and bad food.  PASS.
author: Stephanie N.

description:
My friend decided to try a new thai place so we all gathered and meet up here. The outside doesn't look like much but inside the restaurant is nicely decorated. Service was great, the waitress let us know what were the specials and whatnot. 

The food was pretty good. I am hunting for the perfect duck noodle soup, and this one comes close. The only thing I dislike is the fact that the fat is still on. I would love it if they remove the fat. The broth was very tasty, a little on the salty side for me. We ordered duck spring rolls which were delicious. I would come back just for that. My other friends were also happy with their dishes. I'm holding out on that last star until I come back and sample the other dishes :)
author: emily y.

description:
The food is good and the service is great!  We've needed delivery to my office a couple times and other places were flaky or unreliable on their delivery time.  Allan helped us place the perfect order for us and made sure we got everything on time.  

I will 100% order from them again.  

PS the salad rolls are amazing!!
author: Lisa K.

description:
This place is great!

I went here with a party of 8 for my birthday. We had a 6:30 reservation but we ended up needing more time, so we called them and they saved our table for us! When we got there, the atmosphere was very calming. There's smooth jazz playing in the background and they dim the lights slightly. We ordered the crab fried rice, fresh spring rolls, panang avocado curry, masaman curry, jasmine rice, basil chicken, and pad thai. All their food is delicious but the crab fried rice is really GOOD! A lot of my friends said it was their favorite dish that we ordered. When it was time to light the candles on the cake, they dimmed the lights some more for us -- without us asking. :] They gladly provided plates and spoons for the cake as well. 

SO! Overall. The food is good and cheap. The service is very friendly. The atmosphere is calming. If that's your thing, come here.
author: Stephanie N.

description: The customer service was the best I have ever had at a restaurant. The male server was so kind! They were so friendly and helpful! The food was delicious.  I ordered the pad thai and you just cant go wrong with that.  Then they gave us a special dessert which had coconut mitchells ice cream and it was amazing.  Lookingforward to returning.
author: Elaine A.

description: This place is so dope. I ordered delivery and they were busy so it took a little longer (but honestly I don't get people who freak out about that stuff. It'll get there when they can get it there!). When I walked out to get the food, the driver called out to me "HEY you ready for some Thai food?!" First star. The food was hot enough to eat out of the container. Second star. The food. Was. So. Good. The last three stars. I ordered pumpkin curry, sweet and sour chicken (Thai style) and spicy fried rice. I ordered everything spicy. And let me tell you, it was spiiiiiiiiicy. Like Thai spicy. And delicious. I've got timid white person tastebuds so next time I will probably get medium. But damn. So. Good.
author: Brigid M.

description:
We love their curries and that they use a good amount of veggies in their dishes. 

Super bummed they tightened their delivery radius to exclude Glen Park. We used to order from them once a week. :(
author: H.S. G.

description:
Great little secret Thai restaurant.   Beats other local Thai restaurants hands down.
The atmosphere is chill and elegant, food is highly delicious, portions are generous, and the staff is wonderful.    We recently discovered the Basil Tofu, which my daughter and I both loved.   My daughter (age 11), likes this place so much that we got take out for her birthday (bountiful and reasonable trays of Pad See Ew Noodles -and- egg rolls)
author: Karen S.

description: Found this place last night. The vegetarian section of the menu looked hopeful. We ordered the coconut soup, Tom Kha Pak.. It came out a very long time later with bubbles on the top. Ew. Why bubbles? It was sickeningly sweet. So gross. The only thing good I can say about it was that it was a small portion. Then the red curry came a very long time later (they were crowded) and it was way too salty. We witnessed the table next to us who returned a dish that was way too spicy! Maybe they should hire a taster. The waiter (and there was only one) was smiley and nice yet sweating profusely. So, the search for a good Thai restaurant in the Mission with vegan options continues...
author: Josie L.

description: We went to pick up the food, the beef with basil was not the best, it was spicy as hell and the beef was vainy. The quality of was poor. The Chicken with tofu and peanut sauce was very bland, I decided to mix it together and it was ok but I will not order there again.
author: Magda G.

description: Went there for lunch and the place was virtually empty. The table we were escorted to was sticky on top which was a turn off. Service was extremely fast so much so that we felt rushed. The best part of the whole experience was that the food tasted absolutely incredible! However the portion sizes are roughly half of what they are in other Thai restaurants that I've been to throughout the city.
author: Michael A.

description:
Tofu salad , fish cake and duck basil by "chef Apple " are super delicious .
Quick delivery by "mr Oat"  , he's very nice guy .
Definitely best Thai restaurant on mission street .
author: Aaron V.

description:
This review is for delivery only. 

Reliably delish and my go to Thai place for delivery.  

All the basil dishes are delicious esp tofu basil. Servings are big. I usually order a soup and a main plus rice and it lasts two to three tasty meals. 

One thing to note is if u specify "low spicy" on seamless it's more like medium!
author: Charlotte M.

description: I love this restaurant. Went here last Friday and we had the best service. We ordered the pad thai, pork basil, salmon curry, samosas, duck spring rolls, and the wings. The staff was great and the head chef was amazing. Not only was the food delicious but the service was awesome! I would recommend this place to everyone. If your looking for great food and amazing service, this is the place to go!
author: Jess B.

description:
As someone who has been around the food & beverage industry for 20+ years, I have  a real appreciation for establishments that put love into everything that goes out of their kitchen. The attention to detail and underlying theme of caring for their customers translates into delicious food that makes its way quickly to to the table.

Combine that with very affordable pricing, and you've got one of the best 'bang-for-the-buck' Thai restaurants in all of San Francisco. I recommend this fine Outer Mission / Bernal Heights eatery without hesitation. While I used to really most any dish on the menu, I'm now vegan and really care for their Veggie Thai Samosa, Tofu Pad Thai and Combination Veggie with Tofu, and any of their veggie soups.

I've enjoyed my experiences there so much that I've had to get on a first name basis with the staff, so thanks so much, Alan, and the rest of your wonderful team - your restaurant truly is a neighborhood gem.
author: Scott S.

description:
I took my special lady here and was treated with royal service. 

Dishes here were well valued, tasted amazing, and plated superbly.

The ambience was lively, clean, elegant and comforting.  

The owners were friendly and the servers were attentive. When I was engaged in conversation with my date they would respect our space by not constantly asking "is everything alright?" "Can I get you anything else?" (I find many other restaurant servers extremely rude by disrupting a conversation)

We will be back again!
author: Judge J.

description:
This place is a pleasant surprise. I ordered via GrubHub on a whim. Normally I default to Pad Thai nearby, but they were not taking online orders and they've been pretty spotty quality-wise lately. Ordered fresh rolls that weren't great - almost entirely lettuce and they had a funky spice that I didn't dig. Spicy noodles with chicken were actually pretty fabulous and came in a massive portion. But the real winner was the chicken soup. Lots of white meat chicken in the most incredible garlicky broth. If you're under the weather, get this right away and you'll be cured.

Only real complaint was the extremely slow delivery - I waited more than 90 minutes. But the delivery guy was super friendly and apologetic.

Gonna try it again and diversify what I try. So far, so good.
author: Brooke B.

description:
I took a shot in the dark and decided to try a new Thai place for dinner (take out). At first glance Sweet Basil is small, clean, and very good atmosphere (mind you that I was their first customer of the evening checking in at 5:05PM).  

The service was fast and cordial as stated by other Yelpers reviews. I waited for the food to be ready and chose to stand up while I waited ( I was offered a glass of water and to have a sit), I accepted the glass of water but decided to wait standing up. I got everything packed and I was on my way out the restaurant, I will say they do earn one and a half stars thus far for the cleanliness of the place and helpful service (so far, so good).

Nevertheless, we are here for the food review and it goes as follows:

Appetizers - 
- The Chicken Satay was well seasoned and moist (not dried like other places).
- The Crab Cakes were well seasoned and I was warned that condensation may make them soggy by the time I got home (Thus far, I have not experienced any other restaurant doing that).

Main Dishes -
- Chicken Pad Thai noodles, not outstanding or good, rather it was decent. Noodles cooked well, the chicken was moist and the dish had a nice balance of ingredients yet it lacked the bold flavor that Pad Thai is known for.
- Chicken Pad See Ew, was a very nice dish. The noodles were cooked nice and had that smoky flavor without the sore eye of burned noodles. The chicken was moist, the veggies were not overcooked thou it could use a bit more broccoli.
Shrimp Yellow Curry, now that is what I call curry. Well seasoned, spice on point and it went very well with brown rice (the rice was nicely done). The potatoes in the curry were nice, not under or over cooked.

The overall experience was above average and earns them three stars. However, they get half a star taken off for not double checking that the complete order was in the bag (They missed the Thai Iced Tea and my wife was looking forward to it). The prices for the dishes seem to be on par with other Thai restaurants. In addition, while other restaurants seem to cut back on portions, this restaurant makes generous portions. Definetly going back to try the rest of their dishes.
author: Daniel A.

description:
Ordered delivery through eat 24
Yellow curry was watered down and bland
Pad Thai came with no lime or peanuts and was tasteless

This place was the worst Thai food I've had in a long time.

Absolutely disgusting
author: Jay A.

description:
WILL COME AGAIN.

The main reason? The Massaman Curry was to die for! 

I have to admit, I've never had Massaman Curry before. Or if I have, I never paid much attention to the name. This was the tastiest curry I've ever had though. I mooched off both my friends who had ordered it the whole night. The dish reminded me highly of the Coconut Chicken Soup you can order at Burmese restaurants, which is also one of my faves. SO GOOD!

My dish was the Sweet Basil Chicken. It was yummy, but didn't produce the mouth watering effect of the Massaman Curry.

Paired these babies with a Riesling, which my friend (who worked at a wine start up for two years) informed me was great for pairing with Thai food due to its high acidity (which, evidently, also makes your mouth water). Whatever you say, Jon.

As for the restaurant itself, the decor was very nice: a waterfall curtain at the back of the restaurant, small tables lined up in two rows, but far enough apart that you don't pay much attention to your neighbor. Decorative cushions acted as back rests, and the whole place breathed trendiness. But I only paid $15 for my meal, including tip, whoa!!

The only downside was that two of the servers (one of which was actually the manager, I believe) had a very hard time understanding English (and the service was a bit slow). But as long as you don't do anything complicated with your order, you're good, and they were otherwise professional and friendly.

Try this place. It's in that neglected part of the Mission that's South of Cesar Chavez, so it's easy to get a table here on a busy night.
author: Fawn B.

description: This place is some legit Thai food.  Still has spice to the dishes, just like in Thailand.  My friend got the green curry.  I got the duck basil.  Also, got some crispy rolls as an app and cucumber salad for dessert.  Oh, and a beef larb.  Yummy!
author: T. E.

description:
Got Pad Thai and a beer. Simply AMAZING. Got it at a medium spice and it had a perfect kick!! Like most SF gems the exterior looked shabby while the interior looked clean and fancy. I paid about $12 for everything. Can't beat that!! 

The staff were super friendly and quick to bring everything we needed. I will definitely go back.
author: Maxwell A.

description:
I would give 5 stars for the food but the service was a little questionable. We got the fresh salad roll and they were great and we split an order of Pad Si Ou (no idea how to spell that) and it was phenomenal.

The only issue was that we called to order and they put us on hold about 4 times before we could even order, so we just hung up. Finally my boyfriend ordered online but when we went there to pick it up it was not ready and still had ten more minutes! Too long. They also gave us our food with no fork. It's definitely not required to give silverware but I think it is common courtesy in case the person is not returning home to eat the food.
author: Alexandra W.

description: It is my third time here. I've always been a fan of Thai food, but this is one of my favorite Thai restaurants, especially because any of their entrees can be made vegan-friendly. As a vegan, this is a huge plus for me!
author: Russelle Anne M.

description:
This place deserves to be wildly successful. The interior is extremely tastefully done, the service is superb, and most importantly, the food is fantastic. I spent over a month in Thailand. I know what's up. This place is the real deal. 

Tip: Unlike a lot of Thai restaurants, they don't hesitate when it comes to spice. A good thing in my opinion. But if you ask for it spicy, that's exactly what you're going to get.
author: Brendon S.

description: Dear lord this food is absolutely delicious! The Chicken vindaloo was so great I took it home for left overs and used the sauce on my lunch the next day. The interior is also really nice given that its in a more "dicey" area of mission. High recommend checking this place out, the servers are really nice too!
author: Brittney B.

description: This place is one of my favorite Thai food in the city!!!!  I ordered online for delivery at 5:40 and they were right on time!!  I got the yellow curry spicy and it was PERFECT!!  It was the perfect amount of spice and had a ton of flavor.  I also got the Pad see ew which was also very good.  I couldn't complain about anything about this place.  Unfortunately since I got take out I can't say anything about its location or ambiance.  But their delivery is right on time!
author: Marisa G.

description: Amazing place for Thai food. The food is displayed very well and you feel like ordering everything that they have. Quantity is really good so main course dishes can be shared between two. I tried their ginger fish, spicy noodles and jungle curry and all of them were amazing. If it's Thai then I will be back.
author: Mat U.

description:
Don't know if the chef was having an off day, but all of my dishes were terrible. Ordered the tom yum soup. It was sweet! Like I got cavities eating it sweet! Totally inedible, so threw it all away after the first spoonful. Then ordered pad see ew. Flavorless and greasy. Also ordered the pineapple fried rice, which was sparse and mushy. Finally, all this was delivery and after 1 hour of waiting, had to call in for a status. They lied and said "they processed my order an hour ago and will arrive any minute now". It was obvious that they lied because I got the food 30 min later and the food was piping hot. Otherwise the food would have been cold upon delivery for a dish prepared 1.5 ago. Never ordering again and we tell all our friends and family to not order from them. Beware!
Pad Thai Restaurant on 3259 Mission St (415) 285-4210 is just down the same street and tastes much better with larger portions.
author: Mi M.

description:
Maybe it is different if you go but the delivery we received tonight was not so good.  

Update on this review - the Chef called the house today after we posted this reveiw last night.  He reversed the charges on our meal and brought over some free snacks to the house personally.  The Chef gets 5 stars for his effort to make this right.  I was not home to eat the snacks and my wife said it was definitely better.  Anyway, we appreciated the kind effort and lots of folks on here love this place and at least you know the Chef is a really good and decent man.  Food for thought.
author: Nathan D.

description:
It's a 4 1/2, actually.  My beloved and I enjoyed pineapple fried rice with chicken and shrimp as well as praram with chicken.  The portion size is very large, which I wasn't expecting, nor am I complaining about it :-) .  We both had take home boxes.  The flavor of the food was good.  The bathroom is unisex.  They are very good about keeping your water glass filled. 

The reason it is not 5 stars is because I had a couple of unusual experiences;

I ordered a thai iced tea but it never came so I re-ordered it with a different waitress.  Also, I saw that same waitress box up her party's items, yet when I asked for to go boxes, she simply left them with me. That was odd. I on;y asked her rather than my waitress because she was more visible. 

I  see myself going back.
author: Artemis X.

description:
We have ordered from Sweet Basil Thai 3 times now and it's been absolutely stellar every single time. We usually get the vegetarian fried rice and the vegetarian pad thai (both AMAZING in their own right) and last night we tried their Tom Yum soup and it was delicious! On top of the great food, the prices are very reasonable. And to top it all off, the last two times we ordered for pick-up, they called and offered to deliver to us (we live in the Portola/Visitacion Valley area), even though orderahead.com hadn't given us that option. 
So, to sum it up, great food, great customer service and free delivery! You really can't beat that. Can't wait to order again! :)
author: Andres P.

description:
I found this restaurant through yelp and ordered delivery through yelp site. It came pretty quick. 
Food was yummy. Their papaya salad was good. Green curry was yummy, tons of veggies. :) Flavorful. I usually order Thai food "to go" from a thai restaurant right by my house. But I never liked their food. I'm glad that I decided to try a new thai restaurant today. I like this place. Next time, I would like to try their Massaman Curry, which lots of people wrote good reviews on. 
 
I now found out that they don't use MSG. It's a big plus!
author: Maki N.

description: This place is down the street from my job and I have enjoyed the little times I've came in to pick up lunch. The food is great, good taste, great service, and good quality ingredients. Definitely coming back!
author: Josue M.

description:
My vegetarian wife loves this place! 
5 stars if they can better accommodate Gluten-free, but 4 for the effort.
author: Min M.

description:
Oh my god... do yourself a favor and skip this place. We ordered delivery of Tom Kha veggie soup, specifying that we're vegan, Green Curry and Pad Thai, both spicy. Considering 'spicy' is the second hottest option, we knew it'd be hot. 
After taking well over an hour for everything to arrive which was understandable because it's Friday (I guess...we're on 22nd so not far), but when we plated everything, it looked awful. The Tom Kha had next to nothing in it, the green curry was brown and the same consistency as the soup and the pad Thai was a hunk of sticky mess. Whatever, we were starving. 
Our hunger was quickly replaced with sadness since everything tasted like the god damn sun it was so spicy. Ugh. Then, to top it off, there was CHICKEN in my vegan soup...
Obviously I called back and told Alan (the guy who answers the phone) what was up. He told me, "oh yeah, I remember you. You specifically ordered spicy."  I agreed, then added that we didn't order nuclear and it was inedible. Side note: I looooove hot! This was just outrageous. He informed me that we could come in and pick up another order of soup (we're in pjs so no) or that he could refund me for it. I told him we payed cash and he said (verbatim) "well, ma'am, we have cars nowadays, so I'll have the driver head back over." Real smartassy. So I called him out for it and he said, "ma'am, you come at me sideways and I'll come at you sideways." WTF. 
Needless to say we returned everything when the driver came back. He was super nice and apologetic. It's the staff in the restaurant that are the problem. Judging from some other recent reviews, this seems to be a trend. Shame, because their sister restaurant Thai Idea is awesome. 
I won't be ordering from/dining at this place again. 
Oh, and we're still starving.
author: Susie D.

description:
I work across the street, so having a great restaurant that is convenient and delicious is awesome!  

The papaya salad, the pad thai, coconut fried rice, and the fish were really good.  Everyone at my office enjoyed their food.  The manager and staff are very friendly as well.
author: Christina B.

description: Top quality thai food at very affordable prices. Soups are great, curries amazing and prices just right. Really can't go wrong with anything. The green curry and massaman curry are amazing, as is the coconut soup. Highly recommend.
author: Joey B.

description:
Store hours says that it closes at 10:30pm.
Came in at 9:50pm but we were told that the kitchen closes at 9:45! 
What a waste of travel time!
A big BS!
So we went to Pad Thai just few feet away. 
They closes at 10pm and we were able to had our dinner.
author: Lorena D.

description:
Many of you seem to think the dine-in experience warrants the liberal use of exclamation points, so I'll leave it at this: Skip the delivery option. 

Pad thai perhaps sat to long in its own steaminess, making the noodles more or less a starchy paste upon arrival. Massamun curry was inoffensive, but flavor-wise was completely indistinguishable from the pad thai... so, not great. Niether dish had any garnish or herbs floating around, so it was all together very.... beige? I dunno, I feel like usually, places will toss you a sprig or two of basil or cilantro and lime wedge at the very least.  

(Papaya salad, on the other hand, was tasty! And goddamn, it was spicy.  Heads up in case that's not your thing.)
author: Laura F.

description: This is my favorite thai restaurant in SF. The pumpkin curry and pad see ew both hit the spot every time. Top it off with the Thai iced tea and you have a perfect meal.
author: Drew M.

description: I love this place. Great food, nice presentation, friendly servers, local feel, and awesome happy hour!
author: Heather D.

description: I very like sweet basil restaurant . Me and my family went to enjoyed dinner every week. Thai food is healthy. Sweet basil is the best restaurants in SF.
author: Yda Y.

description: I'm huge into Pad See Ew, and theirs was awesome.  Would have preferred Chinese broccoli as opposed to American, but didn't ask.  Got tofu as the protein a and it was perfectly deep fried and yummy. It was also A very good price for the portions they gave.    I got delivery, and will definitely order again!
author: Lily W.

description:
I've been to Sweet Basil three times. Every meal has been delicious and beautifully prepared. I loved the Tom Yum soup, the spicy green beans, and recently shared egg rolls, pad thai, and a seafood with chili paste dish that were outstanding! 
The owner and chef is very friendly and proud of his restaurant and the staff is helpful too.
author: Susan G.

description:
The food here is delicious. Sadly, I'm giving them 1 star for my multiple bad delivery experiences.

They are consistently bad/late/inaccurate at delivery. If you try to call them to figure out where the heck your food is, they'll almost certainly have a busy signal. 

Eating in the restaurant is fine. But don't bother asking them to deliver.
author: Munaf A.

description: great food .. its my goo place from now ..i lovee this place .. thai food.. i have oder Delivery  couple days ago .. the food was on time . they took only 20 mints thats it .. the food is also hot nd fresh .. i will definitely recommend this place ....
author: Sharath R.

description:
Came here last night for a friend's birthday and that staff was amazingly friendly and accommodating to our large party coming in at 9:00pm. 

They have an entire vegan/veg menu (one of which was volcanic beef. Um, 'lava sauce' and onion rings? yes) excellent drink deals and the staff was willing to split checks for us. The food was affordable and tasty--would definitely recommend.
author: Allison P.

description: Really disappointed with this restaurant. The food was really too sweet (hence the name?) we even had big chunks of sugar in our Papaya salad... and there is no chili sauce or fish sauce on the table, how is this supposed to be a Thai restaurant? Service was good though.
author: Helene H.

description: Selebrated my birthday here. I ordered everything ahead for 8 people. They made our alcohol drinks half off and all other drink for free. And allowed us to stay for one hour after closure. Food was delicious, especially appetizers, green curry, cashew chicken and soup, paper chicken was OK, but papaya salad was too spicy. In general everyone liked it a lot. I would definitely selebrate my next occasion there.
author: Vlad K.

description:
Chef Alan, you the bomb!! It used to be Dusit Thai then another Vietnamese/Thai infusion resto until Alan renovated this place to a Vegan/Vegetarian along with regular Thai foods. The place is amazing, great decor not too overly done with modern embellishments. Went for a spontaneous dinner here after a crazy work day. Had their Tom Kha Goong and Vegetarian tofu Red Curry. The Red Curry was tasty and on point!   Their Tom Kha Goong I think was good since my coworker had it.  We didn't try out their dessert but they all looked great perhaps my next visit.

The also have happy hour!!

I will definitely come back here to try out the rest of their menu. Worth trying it out...especially to Vegans and Vegetarians!!
author: Sarah S.

description:
Really great Thai food.   I always have the Prig King chicken.   My friends can also eat here because they prefer mild food and it is okay to ask for mild with being treated with contempt. 
Large vegetarian selection also.
author: Thomas P.

description: My roommates and I order delivery from Sweet Basil about once a week, and it is always a good experience!  Quick, tasty and consistent. . . they also have one of the nicest delivery guys I have ever met.  Not much more you can ask for!  Favorites include: pineapple fried rice, scallops in black pepper sauce, and massaman curry with Chicken.
author: J D.

description: Not the most authentic thai cuisine but still delicious. Good and many options on their menu. Vegetarian friendly. Foods come in big portion and pretty presentation. The people here is very friendly. I will definitely be coming back again! Can't wait to try more of their dishes!
author: Kalena S.

description:
I had lunch at Sweet Basil today with my son. We have walked by the restaurant a few times, and thought it looked like a place we should try. Wow! Glad we decided to do so today. The restaurant has a pleasant and modern decor, very comfortable with nice jazz playing in the background. Unexpected! Not at all what one would expect to find here on this part of Mission.
Food was superbly presented, seasoned and perfectly cooked. 

This is a ridiculous value and an unexpected experience. Allen, the maître d', provided another surprise; professional hospitality and service.

We'll be back, and I'll be trying the Foster City location soon.
author: Dean T.

description: I've been here a couple of times, and have never left dissatisfied. Food is great, service is attentive, and presentation of dishes is beautiful! Definitely a must try - duck curry and spring rolls!
author: Nicole F.

description: Ordered delivery. Dude on the phone was SUPER nice , awesome customer service.  BUT, once my food arrived, I was 2 times disappointed.  1) The Tom Yum soup was extremely bland and watered down. 2) The Pad Thai was some of the wackest I've encountered.  Flavorless sauce, zero crushed peanuts, zero lime or Thai basil. I will never make this mistake again. Just sayin.... any one who says this is even "good" Thai food is TRIPPIN!!
author: Mel Z.

description: Ordered a number of dishes for delivery. None of them was particularly delicious, and underwhelming--I ended up not eating most of it. Would not order again.
author: Keito U.

description: Nice Thai place.  Great service, good atmosphere.  Had Green Curry with Tofu - Brown rice is an option.  Very good.  The spring rolls were exceptionally good - could definitely tell these were much more fresh than you get elsewhere - quite a nice surprise.  Would definitely go back.
author: Kevin D.

description: One of the delicious Thai restaurants in SF. So glad to find this place using Yelp:) Ordered Tom Yum Soup Noodle with Seafood which was amazing. Vege Samosa was also super good!
author: Maitai N.

description: The food is always great.  They are very good about our allergies.  I so wish their was a restaurant like this with as good service where I live. We drive two hours to eat here and then take lots of food back home.
author: Rose N.

description: We got take out Pad Thai and soup and they are as good as any Thai place on that area of Mission. What was really special was that after I told the person who took my order that I needed soup for my friend who was sick he included three teas with the order--just for her and for free!
author: Susan W.

description: I had the flu and needed some chicken noodle soup, and theirs was perfect! Just what I needed with a little extra flavor. Added some brown rice and I was on my way to getting better.
author: Lexi M.

description: Worst Thai food I've ever eaten.  Really baffled by all of the great reviews.  Blech.
author: beth b.

description: Food is great, however the owner is extremely rude, has a belittling demeanor and is prejudice against people whose first language is English. This has been the second time I've been yelled at by Alan and I will not order delivery here ever again. Maybe if I were a business owner as he mentioned, I would be respected. But I'm not so how about you put me down some more and then tell me to call back and order. What a joke!
author: Casandra W.

description: I've enjoyed everything I've gotten here so far and I've become a regular customer. One caution, if you don't like spicy then add comments specifically stating "no spicy", because even their mild spicy option when ordering online has a kick.
author: Justin D.

description: Wow! A delicious thai restaurant that's great for groups. Speedy preparation and good service!
author: Genevieve J.

description: Not a nice or friendly place!! Here from out of town and looking for some food to delivered to my hotel. I called to make my order and I was 1/2 mile out of the delivery area. Asked if we can pay a fee to still have it sent. We were told "No and that we do sometimes deliver out of are area but today I'm not and so you can come pick it up" Can I say wow!!!
author: D D.

description: Found this place on yelp, and was so happy with the food. My boyfriend and I came here before leaving SF. Friendly staff, quick service and great food! I will definitely return when I'm in the area next.
author: Kimmie L.

description: Amazing!!!! Super delicious fresh food!!! Excellent service and a great happy hour!!! Definitely coming back soon!! Wings,soup and garlic seafood dish was wonderful!!!
author: Raquel G.

description: Found this place through my EAT24 app and have ordered from this place a handful of times now.  Food is consistently good and delivery is always within the 45-60 min mark.  Have had Pad Thai, chicken fried rice, fish patties, chicken skewers and my favorite, the Rad Na(?).  Its the the noodles with gravy sauce.  Tastes great.
author: Gilbert C.

description: Low class .People have different experiences depending on if you eat in or get it delivered ...I work for a food delivery app , I went to sweet basil to pick up two orders .. No one was in the restaurant beside me ... Was patiently waiting until Alan shows up ... The food was late and after waiting a looong time he did not apologized  for the food being late ( he actually said " it's ok " when I mentioned it) when the food came he literally pushed all 8 items from his counter towards me ... I asked him if I could get a bag politely , and he asked me 20 cents for them ... I felt like I was at Safeway ...  Anyway very cold and rude. Alan you are disgusting and I will never  eat at this place because of your unprofessionalism .... It's a nightmare for a restaurant owner to have that type of employee . Anyone that walks in a business is a potential customer ... Alan you are a  Low first  class ass kisser .
author: ali r.

description:
Sweet Basil has taken over the Mission Street location of Thai Idea, an all-vegeatarian Thai restaurant. They're using Thai Idea's website, menu, and phone number but not alerting customers (at least on the phone) that ownership has changed and the food is no longer vegetarian. My husband (vegan) and I (vegetarian) picked up our order and were a few bites in when we realized some of the dishes had beef and shrimp in them. Luckily neither of us is allergic to shellfish, so we were just grossed out and not hospitalized. 

The food we were able to eat was mediocre at best.
author: Hilary R.

description: Everything I noticed about this place was good. The wide noodle dish was tasty, and at $8.50 for enough for two people I'd call it pretty affordable for San Francisco. The waitress was friendly and everyone working there was polite. The place was clean and the food came quickly.
author: Alex M.

description:
Let me start by saying the manager Alan flat out told me that for the price I was paying "you are not ordering gold."

One hour after ordering delivery I called to see how long it would take.  He told me at least another 45 minutes, mind you I ordered two soups and a salad.  First I was told they were extremely busy and that's why it took so long, them I was told they just received the order... Who know which was true.  I told them I still wanted it, at which point the manager told me I would not be getting the flat noodles bc I was not charged for them.  I told him that I wanted them and would pay for them once they got here at which point he said that the order was cancelled and I would receive a refund.

Long story short... A pregnant lady sat there with no dinner and an extremely rude manager who canceled the order bc again admittedly his good "was not gold."

Hopefully going in is more pleasant, but I would steer clear from delivery.
author: Rhea R.

description:
I'm effing hangry right now, i'm not gonna lie. I was willing to wait an hour for my food but certainly not an hour and a half...still waiting though. Whoever I spoke with said it could take another 20 min but they're on their way soon.

Don't tip before you get your food!
author: J S.

description:
I really wanted to like this place. I did. It's super close to my house, and once a year, when I get an insatiable craving for pad thai, I have to have it right NOW.

I ordered 3 dishes for delivery - pad thai with tofu, green curry with tofu, and their papaya salad.

Pad Thai - Okay, not too sweet and super spicy, just how I like it (I specifically asked for less sugar and more spice). Got very greasy towards the bottom of the container.

Green Curry - Wait, what was that? It definitely didn't taste like any green curry I've ever had and I've had a lot. I question if it's even coconut milk. No aromatics from lemongrass, ginger or galangal. Really disappointing. I had to throw out the whole container because it was so inedible.

Papaya salad - Super spicy, and nothing else. No flavor, no balance of tartness or sweetness. I also had to throw this out because it was so sour I couldn't even eat it without grimacing.

So, after tip and tax, I ended up paying $32 for a mediocre box of Pad Thai. Should've known better. Damn you, cravings. :(
author: Michelle D.

description: The food is very good and the service is excellent.  Every time we go, we ask Alan (the owner) to come out and tell us what to order.  We've never been disappointed.  Make sure to order the Massaman (sp?) curry, the yellow curry is also very good.
author: Iris F.

description: 6 months pregnant with a raging cold...only looking for some hot chicken soup and some light refreshing salad rolls. Ended up with a bonus with my delivery order... used band aid sent wrapped up in the salad roll- no charge. Generous, right? GROSS.
author: Nichole J.

description: I had the pineapple rice. I've been to Thailand and this was one one of the best dishes I've had. AND the chef is super nice. I love this place.
author: Danielle P.

description:
this is for the delivery. guy who came to deliver was friendly and food came within the 45 min timeframe.

however, the food was pretty bad. we ordered a selection of curries (with chicken), pad thai, and pineapple fried rice. the chicken in the curries were so incredibly dry that using sriracha didn't even make it any easier to chew. i was very disappointed. the pad thai was pretty bland and below average. the pineapple fried rice was probably the best one except the pineapples were almost non-existent.

i appreciated the good service but i don't think i'll be ordering again.
author: Jenny T.

description: They delivered our order, which was $43, to another house and then refused to send us another order. They didn't believe that we didn't get the food and said the slip was signed. I mean come on! Anyone can sign anything. Ridiculous. I've placed 5 or more orders from here in 4 months and will never order again. Who offers the customer to pay another $43 for a second delivery of food to make it correct?!?? There's another Thai place two doors down from them that's just as good if not better. I suggest you order from them.
author: Aaron M.

description: This Thai food is super bomb. Excellent pad kee mao can't believe it only has 4.5 stars wow I can't stop going here omg
author: Lucas M.

description:
I expected much better from all the good reviews here.  

We ordered delivery and it took 90 minutes.  They had taken down the address correctly, but got the cross-street wrong.  As the cross-street they thought we said is only a few minutes away, but does not actually intersect with our street, one would think that this mistake wouldn't take 45 minutes to rectify.

Problem number two was that they misheard my order for chicken satay and sent something else.  This is the only thing my kids reliably eat, so that created an issue.

Problem number three - I had asked for everything mild.  I don't necessarily expect it to be mild enough for small children, but two of the dishes were really spicy.  Like leaving your lips burning spicy.  If you're going to offer a range of spiciness, I think the lowest degree of spice should be well less than that.

Overall, the food was meh.  Nothing special.  The left-overs sat in the fridge for a week and were thrown out.
author: Christina F.

description: I had an impromptu birthday party last night. i called and ate at the restaurant last Saturday and to pick my order for my party on Sunday, Feb 23  Allen the manager was really helpful of helping me with my budget and ask me how many people i was planning to invite. I prepared to invite 30 people but still I had 20 guest and Allen prepared and gave me a good menu. He prepared the menu from appetizer, soup and salad, curry and to the main dish and help me with all the needs of my diva guest. Thank you so much for serving and making my birthday a success.... I will make sure to all my party at your restaurant. All my guest was so impress and happy with the great service and most important which is GOOD FOOD!!! GOOD SERVICES and VERY CLEAN....
author: George F.

description: My bf and I came on a Saturday night and surprisingly it was pretty empty for the most part. We loved the food and service. The waiter was VERY courteous and honest with us the whole entire meal. He suggested that we were over ordering (as usual) and checked in with us from time to time. The food presentation and taste were delicious for the price. We only regret that we found this restaurant a little too late as its only a 7 min drive from home. Definitely be coming back :)
author: Karen T.

description: I would defintely come back here, Sweet Basil Thai is a small yet modern cute place. The menu is well explained and the food itself was delish! Waiter was very nice and attentive. Try this place!
author: Alyce S.

description: This place is awesome. Veggie friendly, huge portions. We asked for spicy and it was super spicy. The staff seemed very worried that it was too spicy for us and kept asking  if we were fine, refilled our water constantly and brought ice without us asking. Really sweet and attentive!
author: jean l.

description: Their pad Thai was nothing short of disgusting. Bland flavor, very soggy noodles, just overall gross. I'm not sure why this place has so many good reviews. Do yourself a favor and find some other place.
author: Cecilia C.

description: I'm  very disappinted we are  not going back in  that reasturant  agine .first I order bottle of  Franciscan wine and she bring out opened  Blackstone wine , and I told the  server  this not what I orderd she respond we don't have Franciscan .At  the end they add the gratuity on check and my husband ask why did you add  the tip  respond was  because you are four , my  two little  kids and my husband . I couldn't believe it I walk out with a lot of  diappintment.
author: Helen D.

description:
Delicious! Really loved their pumpkin curry and had the tastiest pad kee mao ever. And when I asked for extra spicy, they didn't look at me suspiciously and then give me mild food... They actually made it spicy! 5 stars for that! Usually places will give me mild when I ask for super/Thai spicy and then bring the side of chilies instead... not the same- they take over the flavor of the dish. Well done, Sweet Basil. Very delicious food, and the handful of times I've been there (always to eat in), service has been great. Not to mention the price is right, especially for such a beautifully decorated place with a peaceful ambiance and lovely presentation of food.


Oh, and 3 words... mango...sticky...rice
author: Marie W.

description:
This place totally deserves a 5 stars on multiple aspects - but most importantly, the staff and the manager, Alan, were hands down the most helpful and friendly staff I've ever seen in the city. They were willing to give us a reservation for a large group of 25 people with NO hangups like everyone needs to be there at the reservation time to be seated. This was particularly impressive as this restaurant isn't very large, and 25 people meant us occupying half of the restaurant! Alan himself took the initiative to list out a menu that would work for all of us before hand, and was VERY FLEXIBLE on making the dishes to our food constraints. He even allowed us to have the space until closing time, which was pretty awesome!
The food itself was amazing too! Alan got us started with thai iced tea, followed by thai samosas and crispy spring rolls, followed by pad thai, tofu yellow curry and chicken massaman curry. He personally made sure that food came out in good time, and that it was distributed such that everyone could easily access it. Even the rest of the staff was super friendly and helpful and catered to all our requests with a smile! :) They even let us get in a birthday cake, held it for us in the back and set out all the plates and spoons for us, all at no additional cost! :D
The presentation of the dishes was also pretty awesome, especially the spring rolls which came in a martini glass! (you can check it out on one of the images here!)
Last but not the least, this place has AMAZING prices, the portions are large and all in all it was super reasonable!
We all had a lot of fun, a big thank you to Alan and his staff - We'll surely be going back again!
author: Juthika D.

description: Had the yellow curry with duck and pad see ew with chicken. Both good, but not spectacular.
author: Maximillian M.

description: ehh mediocre at best. The delivery took well over an hour; the pad see ew noodles were barely cooked and minimally flavored; the fresh tofu spring rolls are mentioned to have mint, however, they are fully stuffed with lettuce and a small piece of tofu (no mint); and the tom yum soup is very bland and sweet. I was excited to find a thai place close to my house, although, very let down by the lack of flavor and delivery wait time. I will not be ordering here again.
author: Kait W.

description:
The positive Yelp reviews don't lie!

I spent my 22nd birthday here in July and it was a success! I reserved a party of 25-30 (26 showed up). To make it easier I pre-ordered the food that morning, but the manger Allen gives you a lot of options. 

The food was delicious and presented well. Also affordable! We ate family style. Everyone paid less than $20 each. 

The ambiance in the restaurant is also nice. And the service was friendly (water always filled).
author: Rachelle V.

description: I'll make this sweet and simple- BEST Thai food in the mission district! My co workers and I have lunch here at least once a week! Alan is the best ever! He knows exactly how to treat his customers! 10 stars! If your not eating here... Your missing out! -steph xoxoxo
author: Stephany M.

description:
I loved this place when it was Thai Idea and on a visit a couple days ago was pretty disappointed.

Maybe my server just wasn't aware, but when I asked for the vegetarian menu (mentioned in other reviews, was expecting the full menu they used to have as Thai Idea) she said there was none, but that almost anything with meat on the menu could be made with fake meat. The vegetarian section on the new menu is actually pretty short and boring, but we stuck to it, since neither of us are huge fans of fake meat anyway.

On earlier visits to Thai Idea (both the one on Polk, and when Sweet Basil Thai was a Thai Idea) I honestly felt it was some of the best Thai food I'd ever had. It had complex flavors and legitimately spicy. I had even talked it up to my friend quite a bit. On this visit we asked for a vegetarian version of the green curry, vegetarian spring rolls, and chili green beans.

While the presentation is still beautiful, the food was kind of boring. The green curry was not very flavorful and did not come with the vegetables advertised--lots of carrots and green beans, and some cabbage, but no eggplant, sadly. The chili green beans were okay but not very exciting, or Thai-tasting, either. 

It's pretty close to my house but I'm sad to say I probably won't be back. Maybe when they decided to start serving meat they also decided to Americanize their food a bit---it just seems bland now. It sort of feels as if they sold out, and it's a loss, and not just because it used to be much more veg-friendly.
author: Tamara F.

description: Solid chow, dependable service.
author: Rick S.

description: I ordered the Tofu Pad Thai (extra spicy) and it came out great. The presentation was nice, the service was above and beyond (thanks Alan!)  I'll be back again and try the dessert next time.
author: Ryan M.

description: I was extremely surprised by the sever service we had. The reason being was this was my go to place and the food was incredible. They have done a 180.  I won't be back.  I don't need to be cussed at by anyone and they must have a new cook.
author: michelle b.

description: It was definitely worth the wait! The pad thai was delicious, the green curry (ordered mild) was super spicy. I would order from her again.
author: James E.

description:
inconsistent food recently. as a vegetarian i order one of a handful of items, so i'm pretty used to the dishes over the course of time. tonight's par am tofu was watery and completely bland despite having ordered it spicy (and confirming they heard "spicy"). it's a shame, as i had the same dish 2 nights previous and it was good but not great. 

so disappointing when a restaurant opens with slamming good food for 6 months, and then the inconsistencies creep in, and before you know it you've had 2 shitty meals in a row and that's that. 

sweet basil, you've got one more chance.

Update: spoke to the chef and she figured out the problem that was making this dish watery. I've had it several times since and it's been just great!
author: Rossa S.

description: Has vegan options, including vegan fish sauce. I ordered a duck pad thai and the duck ended up being mock duck... Luckily I love mock duck, but that could get horribly confusing for a meat eater. It sounds like from the other reviews that all the meat is mock? But when I asked them to make my mom's eggplant vegetarian, they said ok, tofu. CONCLUSION: If you want meat, double check and ask if it's mock meat or real meat. Horribly confusing place. But delicious.
author: Leslie Y.

description: I waited two hours to get my food (ordered delivery). When I finally called to check on where it was, the manager told me he had 9 orders ahead of me. When I said that it was unacceptable that I had to wait 2 hours and that it was going to take longer, he SCREAMED at me and told me I was wasting his time, and hung up on me. He also canceled my order. It was not only ridiculous that I had to wait so long but also outrageous that I was spoken to like that and hung up on. I will never ever order from Sweet Basil again, and I will tell all my friends to never order from them. I can't believe they're running a business that way...
author: Jessie A.

description:
Recently went to Sweet Basil (07/18/13) and had a good experience.  Was greeted as soon as we walked in - wasn't too busy (early evening around 7pm) - had a good table by the window.  We were provided water & menus.  The waiter asked if we wanted to start off with anything to drink - he said that "happy hour" was still happening - so we were pleased with that.  He brought a menu for us - but wonder why it wasn't provided along with the dinner menus?  Had some beer & wine (which is their only choice - that's fine) - but I wonder if they really charge $10,00 for a glass of wine (which aren't large glasses) - if it's not "happy hour" - it was just chardonnay Clos Du Bois.  Probably should have gotten bottle, as had three glasse & does add up.

The owner/manager also spoke with us, very nice, asked if we'd eaten here before - no first time.  Then said he had made some mango stickey rice, which he'd serve us for dessert, as took 6 hrs to prepare.  Sounded great.  He said their portions were big.  We ordered some appetizers, but we were disappointed - the portions really weren't ample enough to share for three people (chicken satay & shrimp rolls).  Although the entrees were good portions.  

It started to get a bit busy - we finsihed, but never saw the owner/manager again - I wonder how the mango stickey rice was?  Oh well, I guess he forgot or got busy?

We'll probably go back - liked the happy hour & maybe next we'll try the mango sticky rice.
author: Suzi P.

description:
Poor service. Loud annoying music. All dishes taste the same. Bad.. very bad ....very very bad attitude. Food is not hot. And all dishes come out at the same time. Please hurry up and eat and get out is their attitude.  Push push and eat ,,,hurry up and leave..bye bye.  

And the benches you sit on are very hard.  

Other Thai places are more pleasant and comfortable.
author: rick l.

description: SO down with Sweet Basil Thai. I've been searching for a default delicious neighborhood thai place to have in my life and wasn't satisfied with some other options in the Noe/Bernal area. Really tasty, big diverse menu and they deliver, which is always a plus. Highly recommend.
author: Elena K.

description: I love sweet Basil its not because i love thai food. I really like this place the food is great, the presentation is awesome and the Stuff is really Clean and kind. Im a really picky person And if you are as well And want to try thai food its the place to Go. $? Yeah really good.
author: Gill L.

description: We love this place. It's our new neighborhood Thai takeout spot. Their green curry and pad se ew is off the hook. Sorry Pad Thai but we are over you!
author: Lindsay M.

description: Good Thai food but not the best. Delivery took a long time. And the menu says 5 skewers come with your Chicken Satay, however there was only 4. Not gonna call them and gripe about one skewer but it's still annoying. Won't be ordering from here again.
author: Rachel Y.

description: I ordered the pumpkin curry and it was fantastic! Good service and VERY reasonably priced! I always have leftover sauce since my spice tolerance is low, and when packing up my leftover sauce they even threw in an order of rice on the house! 10/10 would do it again :)
author: Marko J.

description: I really enjoyed this place. The waiter was very friendly and attentive and the owner even came out and said hello. The food was tasty, fresh, and came out fast. Every dish I had was good! And they are very vegan friendly.
author: Carly A.

description: One of the best Thai restaurants in the city. Really nice staff even when only picking up. Food is done fast and delicious!
author: María F.

description: Beautiful presentation, attentive service, delicious food, and very reasonable prices. I've already come back for more, and it won't be the last time! I understand they have free delivery as well, but the dining experience is worth trying.
author: Mr. E.

description:
If you want great food served by even better people, go to Sweet Basil Thai. 

We ordered take out only to have our car battery die while we were inside picking up the food. After a stressful 20 minutes on the phone with AAA, we decided to wait inside for someone to come jump our car.  Not only did the staff plate and serve our food for us, they even jumped our car so we could enjoy our meal without being at the whim of the AAA driver who would show up somewhere in the next 15 min - 1 hour. 

The samosas and pumpkin curry were delicious. We will definitely be back!
author: Emily W.

description: So happy to have finally found a great Thai place close to home! Their curries are to die for, as are their noodle dishes and papaya salad. The owner and chef are also very nice and take extra care to make sure they're accommodating your wishes/dietary requirements (vegetarian vs. vegan, etc). Definitely worth a try if you're in the area!
author: SL N.

description: Perhaps the food is better in the restaurant but I do not recommend the delivery. The food was horrible. We had to throw it out.
author: Claire R.

description: Wow! What an excellent experience! Took my girlfriend after reading the reviews here, thanks to all that posted. Delicious food, superb presentation (very artistic), and super friendly waitresses. Ordered the crab cakes with wasabi cream and soy syrup for appetizers, scallop in black pepper sauce, spicy noodle with beef, brown rice and an order of roti!  Will definitely come back again to try their other dishes. BRAVO!
author: Dhar J.

description: Prices are OK. The one vegetarian dish had tofu that had been soaked in salt and was inedible.
author: L I.

description:
I'm a vegan, so this restaurant is a real find.  My carnivorous dinner companion and I only shared one dish, the green papaya salad, which was delicious -- shredded green papaya with green beans and other vegetables, all very fresh and crunchy, with a spicy sweet-sour chile-lime dressing.  I had the vegetarian coconut milk soup, which was a bit creamier and milder than others I've had, but still excellent.  I was full by that time (the soup is meant for more than 1 person), so I had to take home the tofu and vegetables in green curry & coconut milk sauce.  I just now finished the leftovers, and it's just how I like it -- lots of garlic.  The vegetables, by the way, were eggplant, broccoli, cabbage and carrots.  

I'm afraid I didn't notice what my friend ordered, but he was happy with it.

Unlike most Thai restaurants I've been to, the waiter didn't ask how spicy we wanted anything.  I'd say the green curry would probably be called "medium" in most restaurants.  The papaya salad was spicier, but not too hot.  They are so accommodating about everything else that I'm sure you can request the heat to your taste.

There are lots of vegan choices (and you can ask for a vegan version of any dish on the menu), but since I had a real yen for green curry that night, I didn't try any of the many dishes that were new to me.  But I'll definitely be back, so I'll have plenty of opportunities.
author: Deborah B.

description: Excellent food every time some of the best dam curry and super fresh seafood every time super delicious flavors
author: Roger P.

description:
I rated 5stars by taking lightly.I've been here just once,still wanna go to
this restaurant!!
I had avocado curry w salmon,beaf salad and tsuna something sounds like Japanese.all of my plates were tasty and curry was so yummy!!
Waiter were ok good service except one waitress. I guess they spoke Thai too much tho maybe it can't be helped and better than workers who only wanna speak Thai at restaurant.
Chefs must have experienced cooking skill,waiter seemed doing his best.
This is authentic Thai food in SF,not fishy Chinese food not copy Korean food not Japanese fake food.They have adequate management as stylish Thai restaurant.
I'm little bit sad because this place is far from my place..I already miss their food.
Thank you,hope see you soon
author: S V.

description: delicious food, wonderful decor, great service, lots of vegetarian options. I'll be back.
author: David B.

description: I get take out from here all the time. Great go to thai place. All the curries are amazing
author: Jordan S.

description: Great food, good service, pleasant decor. Definitely coming back!
author: Jim P.

description: We just went there again the other night and the service and the food was just fantastic.  I love their pot Thai and Green curry
author: Alice B.

description: very good service! we have a group lunch for 25 people and Allen gives us much more than we ordered. The quality and the service are great!
author: Kathy L.

description: Good Thai food with friendly staff. We ordered Papaya salad, Panang curry and Pad-Thai. Decent portion sizes, great presentation, customized spice-level, fast service, metered street parking, spacious trendy seating area.
author: Abby Z.

description: The owner always goes the extra mile especially for locals therefore I will go the extra mile and say this place is awesome. Excellent atmosphere and service here. Great fresh place to try here in Bernal Heights.
author: Silicon W.

description:
I absolutely love this place! My boyfriend and I have been looking for a great Thai place in the neighborhood and we previously went to Pad Thai, but they didn't have what we were looking for in terms of taste. We decided to give this gem a try. We've been here three times and each time we tried something new. We were never disappointed. From the Bangkok Duck, to Tom Kha Gha soup (my favorite), to their seafood, we never tasted anything mediocre. That is not to say that the presentation of all the foods looked spectacular! It is really a gem. The atmosphere was also modern and cozy. 
We are making this our regular place!
author: Oksana P.

description: Very good Thai food served with a smile. Newly reopened, so it may take some time for the service to settle in. I will provide full review in a few months.
author: Darren K.

description: I just had to write a review after I got my delivery.  The delivery guy was very nice fist off, no weird delivery moment awkwardness. The food we orders was simple- fresh salad rolls, chicken pad-Thai, and Thai iced tea. The food was amazing and savory. I have eaten at many Thai places in the city and this is my new favorite place. Not to mention as a lifelong Mission resident it has been hard to find good Thai delivery. I'm so happy I now have a new place. A must try!
author: Bessie N.

description: Allen and Justin were super accommodating to the large takeout order I presented to them as soon as the restaurant opened. They were friendly and helpful. They put names on everyone's order and all of the orders were correct. Thank you for the help guys and the food was good too.
author: Cassandra C.

description: We ordered a red chicken curry and a pad see ew.  The red chicken curry was fine, just pretty standard.  The pad see ew was really disappointing. Noodles over cooked and no flavor.  Maybe it was an off night, but we'll go to our "go to" Regent Thai on Church next time.
author: Kelly G.

description:
We tried Massaman Curry as recommended by a previous post.  It turned out to be really good.  Definitely recommend.  Other dishes are also ranging from good to great.  Service is also great.  By the way, this restaurant is the same restaurant in foster city.  Great that I don't have to drive from SF to foster city for thai food then.  

Only one negative.  It might be hard to find parking in that area (I guess you can try to cheat and park at safeway at your own risk), but overall this is not eh fault of the restaurant, so still definitely a four star.
author: Alex D.

description: Bad. Like, wooooooow bad. 4 1/2 star? What have you people been eating up until now??? Again, wow. Bad.
author: Caitlin K.

description: Ordering delivery from this restaurant tonight was an absolute bust. They said 45 - 60 minutes, but did not show up for over an hour and a half.  And the food itself was also problematic.  It was so spicy that it was inedible, and I like spicy.  The cucumber salad was basically just chopped onions. I will never order from this place again.
author: Samantha B.

description: Sweet Basil Thai Cuisine seriously lives up to its name!  SOOOOO Sweeeeeet.  We ordered the pad thai and the yellow curry.  Both were sweet, but the pad thai in particular was just unbearably sweet and didn't taste of anything other than sugar.  Even the cucumber salad seemed to be floating in what tasted like syrup.  Also, i notated on the order "NO Peanuts" since we have peanut allergies in our household and the pad thai came with a big healthy scoop of peanuts right on top.
author: Freedy H.

description: This is concerning their online delivery service. I know it seems odd to complain about an early delivery, but they showed up early at an awkward time. The food was fine, nothing special. I ordered something for dessert that they had run out of. No notification, and they just substituted something else. A refund was requested, attitude was received. Will not use them again.
author: Barbara S.

description: I've had takeout from Sweet Basil a couple times for Pad Thai. It isn't overly sweet or mushy and there is a great balance of noodle to all the fixins. The service is fantastic as well, really nice wait staff.
author: SL K.

description:
DO NOT GO HERE!!!

Just went here for dinner. The first course, Tom Kha soup, was inedible. Incredibly sweet and chalky. Had the pineapple fried rice and duck curry, both of which were mediocre. 

The one star is for the explosive diarrhea I had immediately after eating here. AVOID, and go a few doors down to Pad Thai, it's much better and won't get you sick.
author: Mattie P.

description:
Third time I've been here, and each time it's been delicious, beautiful presentation, with top notch service-- all at a very reasonable price. 

Things that we've enjoyed: Phuket Fish, Thai Samosas, Crispy Spring Rolls, Som Tum salad, Praram, and Sweet Basil Chicken.

Two of the times we went, the owner took the time and effort to come out and chat with us and other customers, and check how we liked the food. Our waiters have always been super accommodating and never a water glass left unfilled.

Food came out fast and delicious every time.

This is absolutely our go-to Thai place in the city.
author: Meagan P.

description: This was a total disappointment. I ordered the spicy beef salad and chicken pad kee mao, and both were not good. The pad kee mao was bland, with no distinct flavor of any kind. The beef salad was just dull as well. The only flavor I can taste is the hot peppers; the beef tasted like it was simply stir-fried and not grilled first (and we found stray pieces of squid?!?). I will not order from here again.
author: Dany C.

description: Great for eat-in, really nice place inside and great for delivery. Curries are delicious, everything seems super fresh. Mango sticky rice was great and the wait staff was super helpful and attentive when dining in. Will keep ordering and dropping by this spot!
author: Jason M.

description: Stopped here on our visit from New York. Excellent food, great atmosphere, large portions, and very friendly and attentive staff (you will never have an empty glass). We couldn't ask for more. The gentleman told us about the daily happy hour specials, and told us about other local hot spots. We will definitely be back on our next visit!
author: Clare C.

description: Everyone here is super nice! I was 40 cents short and I was about to use my card instead but they were just like its fine have a great night. They're yellow curry is amazing, and for a great price! I'm definitely coming here again
author: Michael W.

description: I ordered some pad Thai here a week or two ago for take out. I had never been here before and what I think may have been the manager or owner was there. It was a surprise to see how nice and up to date the place looked, the floor was just mopped and it seemed really nice and neat inside. The person who greeted me was super friendly and the food was pretty affordable in comparison to the portions and how good it was. I have to say the cleanliness and ambience of this place combined with staff friendliness as well as how large and delicious the food was made me want to take my girlfriend here the next time we got together. Very nice cozy place and great affordable food from what I can tell.
author: Dan B.

description: Hurray! New Thai, close-by. 5 stars was easy. I typically get delivery, but without a menu after 9pm on a Saturday night, I thought I'd take a walk up the street and order to go. The place looks great, not too cramped for a narrow storefront, nice ambiance. About half-full when I walked in, not too noisy either. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. I ordered the Crab Cakes appetizer --delicious! Then the Tom Yum Noodle Soup, which I didn't try, but my partner the soup-head says it was quite good, but I should have asked for spicier [noted]. I had the Massaman curry w/chicken. Very yummy, lots of chicken. Finally, a tasty standard of Mango sticky rice for my sweet tooth. All the portions were ample and everything was ready in about 10 minutes. I'm looking forward to sampling the menu now, including a nice variety of desserts that sound fantastic. Check them out!
author: David M.

description: They're good but I miss Thai Idea.
author: Roxy B.

description: Excellent food, excellent delivery service, never had a problem ordering and have ordered multiple times. Food for all diets including vegan. Best Thai food in san Francisco
author: Cos S.

description: Sweet basil, and sweet basil it is.. Taste is on point all the way around if you want good Thai food. If you in the area, give this place a try. You won't regret it.
author: Dahid C.

description: Visiting from New York where I have always loved Thai cuisine and my boyfriend was always "meh" about it. We stumbled on this place and both of our jaws dropped. He had volcano beef and I had massaman curry. Both were so flavorful we almost ate the bowl. The brown rice, even alone, was awesome...thick and with a hull on it, very meaty and flavorful.  The rice!!!!  After this my boyfriend said "wow....now I see what you meant about Thai food."  So yes Thai food is great in sf. But what also made this restaurant great is a few days later we showed back up for lunch. The owner remembered us and sent us out two fantastic desserts to thank us....mango with warm sticky rice and a sorbet ball.  Do yourself a favor and visit this place. Awesome service and awesome food.
author: Nadine M.

description: Sweet Basil Thai is always delicious!  I really love their duck curry and their delicious Soy Thai Iced Tea (and I don't like soy milk, so this is really saying something).  If you're looking for a quick meal, whether dine in or take out, Sweet Basil Thai is always my go-to place.  You won't be disappointed!
author: C B.

description: Super fast delivery and absolutely delicious panang curry!  Yum!  My new favorite Thai spot!
author: Tracy B.

description: Ordered delivery of the Pad Kee Mao and the Seafood w/ Basil. The delivery was estimated to take an hour, but ended up taking more than an hour and half. Both dishes were underwhelming.
author: Julia W.

description: This is hands down THE BEST thai place in SF.  Yelp should let me put 6 stars for the food! The owner Alan works really hard-it's his birthday today and he is serving everyone with a smile. The food is fresh, portions are large, and prices are reasonable. Super classy place with cushions along the wall and this has the BEST Tom kha gai in the Bay Area. Free delivery too!  Come here and see for yourself how good this place is.
author: Kunal D.

description: Spicy, authentic, delicious Thai Food. My date had recently returned from Thailand when we visited Sweet Basil and he was very impressed with the food. While from the outside the restaurant might seem like a place for vegetarians, the meat dishes are extensive and meat-lovers can enjoy this restaurant as well. I highly recommend the papaya salad and the pad ped. Great food and comfortable, clean decor with attentive service.
author: Elena M.

description: The Yellow Curry was nice and delivery was on time, but we found a load of thread/string in the Pad Thai, which made it inedible and has put me off ordering from here again. Very disappointed.
author: Kess V.

description: Great vegetarian food. I've never eaten in, but their take out is fabulous!
author: sam l.

description: If I could give these jerks 0 stars I would. Customer service was appalling. First they took ages to answer the phone,ok, fine, they're busy. But when they finally answered, the guy sounded put out that he had to take an order. After 45 minutes I just now got my food, without my credit card receipt. The driver said there was some mistake made by the restaurant and I should just sign the back of the food receipt, which I did. He said to call the restaurant if I want a copy of my credit card receipt. Which I did. The guy who answered was a total an arrogant a**hole. I told him I'd like a copy of my cc receipt , he asked if I had a fax number - which I don't.  I told him it was the restaurants responsibility to give me a copy.  To which he answered for me to calm down - I wasn't uptight until he told me to calm down - I told him not to speak to me that way, I just want my receipt. He told me to calm down again - wow. I said he was going to lose a customer if he kept telling me to calm down - His response was that he has hundreds of customers....unbelievable arrogant attitude - he takes my money and talks to me that way.  Their food isn't even that good, it's very so-so take out. Not a four star establishment is it? What a jerk. I live in the neighborhood and have lots of friends here who will know about his shitty attitude to his customers.
author: Wendy L.

description: I'm a fan of Thai food. I recently had dinner here with a group of 30 friends. With less than a few hours notice before our reservation, the restaurant manager, Alan, was extremely helpful & accommodating, and made our dinner experience a most enjoyable and memorable one!  Ambiance: trendy, comfortable & clean. The menu had plenty of variety & great vegan options. Price inexpensive & good portion size. Food excellent flavor & presentation. The fresh salad roll & Thai Samosa were delicious. The Som Tum (payaya salad) was spicy hot, so ask for mild if you can't take the heat. Larb salad w/chicken was one of the best that I've tasted. We also had Massaman curry with chicken, string beans with beef, Pad Thai and basil chicken: plus all these in vegan option. Great flavor, but not too salty or oily.  The wait staff were friendly & provided very good service. Will definitely return to try other dishes on the menu!
author: Linda L.

description: Elation, amazement, pure joy are words I would use to describe my reaction to there being a thai place that delivered  to my neighborhood. Since that time almost two years now*wipes tear*  they have been a godsend in the munchie department lol. Turns out im not even in their delivery range anymore but they have decided to continue to deliver to us regardless. The food is cooked exactly to specifications,  and if not they very swiftly ammend any mistakes.  Not to mention the food is awesome with a wide variety, veggie menu extra points!,  lots of spice(the delivery driver laughed after dropping off the last order) and fresh ingredients. Right on sweet basil
author: Glen Z.

description: great Thai food at good prices
author: Nancy M.

description: Thai is my favorite food and at last i have found my neighborhood Thai place.  I can't wait to go back.  We ordered curries and they were fantastic.
author: Andrea S.

description: This place is great. Yummy with fresh flavors and great presentation. My only complaint is that their online ordering system does not work which makes it difficult to call in orders because the restaurant is so loud that talking over the phone makes it difficult to communicate. And the other thing is that there is a lack of vegetables. For example, if you order the vegetarian curry it doesn't really come with much more than the sauce with a few bits of veggies.. As a person who really loves a lot of veggies in Asian food that is the only real lack. But they are the best Thai place in the neighborhood so I'm a fan.
author: s k.

description: I had my pumpkin curry with duck -- best decision of my life. It made for a really great dish. I don't recommend the tea, though. I think they make it with minerally tap-water and it tasted kinda gross... and minerally. The server was great, though, and really nice, and it's the most savory and flavorful thai food I could have hoped for.
author: Mia M.

description: The Best Thai food in San Francisco. Great service! Thank u:)
author: mike m.

description: Had cashew nut with beef, some pieces of the meat tasted so bad. We let the owner know and he kindly handled the situation.
author: Siddika P.

description: Yes, as good as it gets! I have been there more times than I want to admit now, and they only opened 5 weeks ago. It's that good. The decor and the atmosphere is classy and comfortable, the food is good, and I am utterly impressed by the presentation of the food they serve. For the price of a sandwich downtown they give you such good food AND such elaborate plating. I feel very pampered by such attention they pay to their dishes. I also like it that they have such an extensive menu - meat, vegetarian, vegan... and they are cool with substitution however you want. The staff is very friendly without being annoying, and you can really tell that they care about what they do from the way they interact with you. My favorite dish (so far) is the Pumpkin Curry with Veggie Beef. I don't usually like fake meat but the veggie beef is good. I go there whenever I don't feel like cooking... the staff recognize me now.
author: Mei L.

description: Such a great experience!! My friend and I heard a new veggie friendly Thai place had opened and didn't know what to expect. First the ambiance was great, good music and comfy tables. Second, the service was excellent. Allen was an awesome server and friend. He made recommendations, checked on us frequently, and guaranteed good food. Third the good stuff: the food was great! We did veggie options but there were plenty of meat lover choices available that I plan to come back and try. Its nice to find a neighborhood restaurant that cares about the neighborhood!
author: Tracey K.

description: Get the firecracker appetizer. That's what happens in your mouth. Good service. Really good Thai.
author: Mario C.

description: Yum! Nice presentation, very reasonable prices, lovely food, comfortable atmosphere without annoying, loud, house music. The best dine in Thai restaurant in the Mission with the best prices. Their seared ahi tuna was exquisite. Love the sesame crust! Very hospitable and lovely service. Definitely will be back.
author: Simone B.

description: This place is amazing. Delicious food, great service, and a really nice atmosphere. My favorite restaurant in the outer mission. :)
author: Kay L.

description: Best Thai place I've been too, the food is great, tons of vegetarian options and they're super nice
author: Alessandro D.

description: they've expanded the veggie fake meat options! yum.
author: Villager E.

description: We love this restaurant, we probably come here once a week. I try a new dish every time and hubby has pad thai every time :) He samples pad thai all over the city and he thinks the pad thai here is tied with Thai House Express as the best.  I love pretty much every dish I've tried, except for maybe crab fried rice...but then again, crab isn't in season.  The staff is always super friendly and accommodating since we have a 8 month old whom we always take with us.  They don't ask for "spicy" level when ordering though, so you have to remember to tell them "mild" if you don't like spicy food.
author: Jane M.

description: My girlfriend and I went here for her birthday dinner and we left very satisfied with our restaurant selection and the food we ordered. For the appetizers MAKE SURE to have the Thai Samosa, it's very good. Their crab cakes are not bad as well, they totally put a different twist (in a good way) to it. For dinner my girlfriend and I had the Panang Curry and Pineapple Friend Rice; both were good selections. For dessert, I ordered the Mango Sticky Rice! This dessert is good as well. What got me to rate this establishment with 5 stars is Allen, the very attentive and charismatic restaurant manager and his excellent staff. I didn't have a cake for my girlfriend so I asked Allen if it were possible to put a candle on one of the desserts. Allen was very accommodating and he even gave me a tap on the shoulder as a signal that the dessert was coming soon. My girlfriend and I definitely will be back to this establishment. Very amazing experience!
author: Jimmy D.
